campaign.story:
Mockup of how the final book will look
Mockup of A4 Hardback edition
Mockup of the special Colostle themed deck of cards - (final artwork will change)
Colostle, an impossibly massive castle, the interior of which is so large that mountains, valleys, towns, cities and even oceans fill its rooms, with the ceilings and roof so high they are beyond sight, shrouded by the misty expanse of the sky, that sits within it’s vaulted heights.
There seems to be no finding the exterior of the castle with many adventurers setting out with that as their goal. Instead, crossing continental distances, only to reach the wall of a ‘room’. Passing beyond will only bring yet another room on the other side of it, with new lands stretching off just as far again.
Although all manner of threats exist out in the wilds, such as strange animals and beasts, and other barbaric or dangerous people, the greatest dangers of all, are the Rooks. Huge, hulking stone automatons that patrol, somewhat mindlessly, out in the wilds of the Colostle’s rooms.
That is until they are disturbed. Every Rook is different, there are no two the same, and they are the only source of magic in the world. As such, they are something of a target to hunters looking for tech they can scavenge, artefacts they can sell or magic crystals to grant them strange and unpredictable powers.
That is if they can bring one down...
A 'room' stretching out before an Armed adventurer...
What is a solo RPG?
Think of it like a personal, mindful writing exercise, where the game provides you with prompts to write your own fascinating adventure in this strange world. You will be keeping a journal of your adventures, and the game system is a way to determine what you will encounter along the way, and to dictate the outcome of combat. All the book provides is prompts and inspirations, but it is up to you and your character to flesh out the details and to write about what you discover.
First you need to create a character, someone of this world. This book will guide you through this process, but it is completely up to you. Then the game provides you with an outline of your first adventure. You can decide how to interpret these prompts and what to write, there are no limits to what you can do, this is YOUR adventure.

What is in the book?
The Colostle book will be a 24 page A5 tome with all the rules required to create and play your own Colostle adventure. The book will have a thick 300gsm cover with foiled lettering, and the internal pages will be on off-white recycled paper for an otherworldly look and feel. The book will also feature black and white illustrations throughout suggesting glimpses of the world and the kind of characters you could create.
Design of the interior black and white pages (mockup)
How does the game work?
The basic principle is that of drawing cards from a shuffled deck of playing cards, and checking their colour, suit or number against tables to see what they represent for your adventure.
In the exploration phase of the game cards might stand for meeting another traveller on your journey, finding some abandoned ruins or discovering a mysterious doorway. its up to you to write in your journal what these things are and what they mean for your character. The game simply suggests things, like writing prompts, set against a fantastical world... its up to you what they all mean for your greater story. In the Combat phase, cards stand for attacks with the numbers on the cards showing their strength. Playing the right card at the right time could mean victory for your character!
As you play and write you will find ideas for what the mysteries of the Colostle might mean, just falling into your head. I don't provide the answers in the book, every player will discover their own truth and meaning of the world.
All you will need is a deck of playing cards, a pen, some rough paper for making gameplay notes and a journal to record your character's adventures in.
How to Play Colostle - Example of a typical Exploration and Combat phase in the game
3 Unique Character classes
To play Colostle you will need to create a character, and to that end there are 3 unique classes introduced in the book that will help you do that. They are; The Armed, The Followed and The Helmed. All of them use parts and pieces harvested from Rooks that give them special abilities. I don't want to give everything away, as it is only a small book (!) but you can see an Illustration of The Armed class below.
The Armed - wielders of harvested Rook arms
 Rewards + Stretch Goals Breakdown
 Cheaper Shipping Options
If you look in the rewards you will notice that some rewards have an identical twin with the added 'Cheaper Shipping' to their title. This is because I found a cheaper shipping cost later in the life of the campaign after these tiers had been already added. If you are a new backer, and you live outside the UK, please make sure you select the 'Cheaper Shipping' version of the tier you would like, to make sure you get the best deal on your shipping.
(These 'Cheaper Shipping' options only exist for the top 3 tiers, £20 or over. The lower tiers have accurate international shipping as they are, so you don't need to worry about those)
New artwork for the 'Oceans' module!
New artwork for the 'Battlements' module
Who am I?
My name is Nich Angell and I am a comic book artist, illustrator, writer and game designer. I am one quarter of the stories-and-games company Big Punch Studios, creators of comics such as 7STRING, Afterlife Inc., and Cat and Meringue and the super fun card game Sandwich Masters!
I have worked on a lot of comics and games, both from an illustrator perspective and a concept/creation one. More than anything I love creating worlds, whether thats a place to hear a story from, or a place to play a game in, making worlds is my thing! So when I found out about solo RPGs and played a few I realised what an awesome thing they were, a small tight rulebook for a brand new world.
As someone with a wild imagination I am always coming up with new ideas and Colostle is the latest setting that popped into my head. This time though, I was excited to create a more open ended world so that others can experience the joy I have creating stories, adventures and mysteries.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have worked on many graphic novels and as such am extremely familiar with creating books and making artwork printready. I have run a great many Kickstarters both on my own and as part of Big Punch so I am highly confident in the process and know the extent of what is involved.

As with all of my Kickstarters and those I have been a part of, I believe communication is key. I know to update regularly and keep the backers informed even if unforeseen delays or problems occur.

With a small book and a small print run like this I don't foresee any issues. The kinds of things might be print delays, quality issues, and delivery but I have plans for all of these issues if and when they appear.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The book will not be packaged in any plastic shrinkwrap or film, and will be delivered in a fully recyclable cardboard book envelope. The book itself as it is all card and paper is fully recyclable too.
Sustainable materials
All the interior pages of this book are printed on recycled paper.
Environmentally friendly factories
The printers I have selected for this project put the environment first. They have reduced their use of solvents and other hazardous waste down to almost zero, reduced their setup waste to almost zero and recycle every offcut created during the manufacturing process.
Sustainable Distribution
The printer I use are UK based which means any UK orders will not involve costly international bulk shipping. Any international orders will be shipped via the most sustainable package delivery service I can find at the time of sending.

updates.update_content:
Roomlanders!
Sorry its been a bit quiet from me lately! This is only because everything is going so smoothly and I have nothing specific to report! That said, I do want to keep you all up to date with everything there is to know, so I thought I'd come on here with another state-of-play update.
First up, my house is full of boxes of these:

Roomlanders!
The game is out there in the world and the feedback has been amazing! Thank you for all your positivity, good vibes and enjoyment! And a few of you have posted some of your journals of your adventures and they are all without exception, EXCELLENT. I LOVE reading about what your characters are getting up to out there in the Roomlands and some of the ideas you guys are coming up with completely separate of my prompts are stunning. Really impressed. Thank you for really getting into this and making it such a fun community, you guys really are the best!

updates.update_userinfo: DIGITAL PACK 2 & T&Cs for publishing your Colostle stories
updates.update_content:
Hey Roomlanders!
Thanks for all the super positive comments on the digital download! Its so cool to hear about how excited you all are to play Colostle and I can't wait to hear about your adventures.
Thanks to everyone who sent in a typo that they spotted. I contacted the printer and awesomely I managed to catch him in time before going to print, so those typos will be amended for the Hardback Edition, so thats cool!

updates.update_userinfo: DIGITAL CONTENT FILES - Now going out to backers!
updates.update_content:
Roomlanders!
We're finally at the point where I can share the first Colostle rewards with you all! This is super nerve-wracking for me, but I'm also very excited. Its nerve-wracking because this thing started life as such a small project and thanks to all of you it has grown so much. It's my first venture into creating a solo RPG and I really hope it meets all of your expectations!

updates.update_userinfo: CHARGING CARDS and DIGITAL COPIES and BREAD ROLES!
updates.update_content:
Hey Roomlanders,
Hope you are all doing well. Sorry its been a little while since my last update, I've been going through some sad family stuff these last couple of weeks and it's distracted me a little, but I'm back and i'm focused on getting Colostle out to you as soon as possible.
Production has started on all elements but due to a very busy schedule for my Hardback printer/binder, the hardbacks won't be delivered to me until the week commencing 5th of July. Unfortunately this means everything else will be delayed by that date, as I have to send everything all together to the fulfilment company. This means the earliest you guys will probably be receiving your rewards is late July.

Roomlanders!
I am very close now to hitting the final button on the final artwork for the books and sending them off to print! Just got some hefty proof-reading and rules-reading and spell-checking left to do and then we're good. Who knew a book like this would need so many semi-colons and I would miss them all!

Hey Roomlanders!
Just a quick one from me to remind everyone that the Surveys and Pre-orders will lock tomorrow which means you will no longer be able to tweak your order and add or remove any add-ons you want. This also means if you still haven't yet completed your survey, you will not be able to add anything to your base pledge when you come to do it.

Hey Roomlanders!
I am looking to lock surveys and pre-orders on the 30th of April, so that I can begin production on the various elements. This means:
1. If you have already completed your survey but are considering maybe adding another add-on or two, now is the time to do it. You won't be able to add anything to your pledge once the surveys are locked.

Hey Roomlanders,
Quick update from me just to let you know that work is progressing nicely. All the rules are now written, and laid out in the book layouts. I have a master list for all remaining illustrations and there are only 16 left todo!

campaign.story:
Important notice: The delivery of the printed deck will be delayed to January or even February 2021 due to unexpected high interest, winter holidays and a non responsive manufacturer. Read more about it in the update #5

Have you ever had the problem of needing to describe a dungeon and none of the players could really imagine how the structure is actually built? You don't always have to draw a battle map. Sometimes a small picture is enough to quickly show what the situation around the players looks like. Or did you ever try to come up with a dungeon room on the fly and just could not come up with an interesting layout? This deck of dungeon cards is perfect for those situations. 36 (now 54) unique cards full of stairs, dark corners, slim corridors, claustrophobic rooms, crates, barrels and much more to place monsters and treasure in.
Cards can be either used separately or combined to form larger dungeons. You can reveal one card after another as your players make their way through the dungeon and make them curious about each corner.
The cards are made out of professional 310gsm card stock with a blue core and smooth linen finish for the professional look & feel. The deck comes in a custom printed tuck box with a protective matte coating to give your cards the home they deserve. 
Speaking of... Each map (as well as the back of the card and the box) is completely hand-drawn. All 36 cards are already done and just need to be sent off to the printer.
So why Kickstarter? This is a test for me to see if such a deck is even wanted by enough people. If this project gets funded I can let the cards print for a reasonable price per deck without making a loss or charging an impossible high price.
Support Tiers
5€ - Get the PDF
You will get the full Deck of Dungeons (including the back side) as a PDF. This is perfect for those that would like to support this project but can't (or don't want to) afford the price of the physical deck + shipping costs.
15€ - Get the printed deck
You will get the physical Deck of Dungeons. Perfect for Dungeon Masters, as a present or just as a collectors item.
18€ - Physical & digital deck
Get both - The PDF and the printed deck. This is for people who play classically as well as digitally or want to collect the printed deck and use the digital one.
If you want more than one deck please contact me with the shipping country. I would need to calculate the additional costs depending on where to ship. Thank you for your understanding :)
Stretch Goals
I am very hesitant when it comes to stretch goals for this project. This is my first kickstarter and I just want everyone to get what they expect and as smoothly as possible. But if the project gets a lot more supporters than expected, I probably have no choice. So here is the goal:
[Unlocked] 300 Supporters - 54 Cards
If we hit 300 or more supporters I will increase the number of cards in this deck to 54. It doesn't matter if for the physical deck or the PDF version. If we reach 300 backers the deal is sealed. I will invest some extra time to come up with 18 additional cards.
So if you would like to have a thicker deck make sure to share this project and encourage your friends to grab a copy as well ;)
 Shipping
The Deck of Dungeon gets shipped worldwide. The shipping costs will be added after you selected your pledge level. 
Germany: 6 €
Rest of the EU, USA, Canada, Japan: 11 €
Rest of the world: 13 €
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even though this is my first kickstarter I am fairly confident that everything will go smoothly. The designs for the deck and tuck box are done and I already got several prototype prints of the deck from the printer to check the quality and made some adjustments.

Of course it is always possible that something goes wrong during each step of the process and the shipping could get delayed. But I will try everything possible to avoid those problems and keep you updated on each and every step.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Checking and fixing all this might take me another day or two. I will make sure to get it done as fast as possible.

Greetings!

updates.update_content:
Everything has shipped (almost) - now I'm just sorting through the couple oddball leftovers, like address errors, missing stuff etc. The majority of you should have something on its way if it hasn't already delivered. Check your Backerkit log-in for tracking info.

My sincere appologies for the optimistic delivery date. I've never seen anything like this. In the past when I have a shipment with a lot of pieces they always arrive together (and in about 3 days with air-freight). These shipped late October and there's still one box that hasn't arrived. I think it's lost, UPS isn't able to tell me much.

Hey y'all! It's been the weirdest thing, UPS is giving me the shipment a box or two at a time. In the past with air freight I have them in 3 days - it's been about 35 days.  I still don't have them all yet but I'm going to start shipping the orders I can. So some of you will start receiving yours next week. Backerkit doesn't automatically send you shipping information so you'll need to check your survey. You should be able to go to the Backerkit link you got to fill out your survey and see the status of your order. If it has shipped you'll see the tracking number. Sorry, I wish Backerkit automatically sent them out but they don't.

So, 
I've been watching the same tracking number all month and I was so excited to see it was out for delivery. I have 29 cartons coming and we were ready to receive them and ship them out to you. I even wrote an update with the good news but decided to wait to post it. I watched all day and then a little unmarked mini van pulled up and a lady got out with one box. I asked about the other 28 and she was like, uh.... She called her supervisor and then they called around. Apparently they're in LA and they just shipped one. Huh? The freight company assures me they are not lost but just delayed because UPS is so swamped.

Just a quick update... The shipment has been in customs since the 13th. I wanted to wait until it was released to give you some good news but I didn't want to leave you hanging too long. So... I'm hoping it'll be released any day now and then it'll arrive here a day or two later. I'm only a few hours from LA so it won't take long. The lesson learned here is don't make any shipping promises anywhere close to Black Friday because all freight and customs are going to be busy. The good news is we're ready to ship them, I have all the shipping supplies ready to just add the rewards and drop in the mail.  Keep your fingers crossed!

Hey y'all! Good news, the factory has shipped them to me. The bad news is (because of everyone's rush to get products for black Friday) instead of the normal 3 days shipping it will take 15 days :-(  That's my fastest shipping option.
So... we missed the October target date. But they're done and on there way. Stay tuned!

Hey everyone, just checking in. The factory is wrapping up and should be ready to ship everything out on the 26th. I should have them about three days later and will be ready to start shipping them to you. This is completely insane that the Kickstarter ended two weeks ago and your rewards are almost ready to ship out. 

I'll let you know when I get them and what to expect as far as shipping goes. After they ship, you can log into Backerkit to get your tracking number.

Surveys have started. Backerkit requires me to send out only 5% of the surveys first to troubleshoot any potential problems. So 5% of you will get your survey today. If those go well, the rest will go out shortly after.

Add ons! Please note that add-ons are available for backers at Kickstarter prices. Others will not be getting these deals. Also note that we are sold out of the original size blank sketchbooks on our web store so you are getting first dibs on the small amount of stock I'm getting in. Once those are gone the next batch won't be in until the end of November.

Thank you everyone!

campaign.story:
Illustrators. Stop Starving. Start Thriving. 
Discover how you can turn your art skills into your own thriving career in Illustration. 
FACT: Being an Illustrator is tough!
You have hopes and dreams to make it big as an artist; but you don't know how to make it happen. Still, you push along doing the best that you can. Yet, as you move forward you can't help but feel stress & anxiety about the future. "Will I actually succeed with my art?" "Is it even possible to find an art career that will pay my bills and  fulfill me creatively?" To make things worse, you sometimes cave into your fears because of social distancing and/or your past.
Well, listen up! If you want to earn a solid living with your art skills, if you want to be recognized for your brand/content, or if you simply want to land your dream art job, then you need to read what I'm going to say...


Stop doubting! Your successful career in illustration is possible. I've written a guide to help you make it happen. 
These may be BOLD words from a stranger - Why can I make you this promise?


My name is Will Terry and I am a successful  illustrator. - I’ve illustrated over 30 children’s books for publishers like Scholastic, Penguin Random House, and Simon Schuster. I co-founded the wildly popular illustration podcast - 3 point perspective. I co-founded SVSLEARN.com with Jake Parker and Lee White where we teach illustrators all over the world. I’ve created a thriving comic convention brand. I taught illustration and business practices for 9 years at UVU. I’ve been giving entrepreneurial advice on my popular YouTube channel  for over 10 years!
The point is, I've made my own successful illustration career. I, along with 12 other award winning illustrators, will show you how to make yours.

 What They Don't Teach You In Art School is a guide to help you create new opportunities using your art skills to pay the bills, even if you have no prospects right now. 
In this BEAUTIFUL 300-page fully illustrated hard cover book; you're going to learn:
Industry Insights
You will learn the most relevant professional practices I use in my career to this date. To name a few: How to find clients, how to price effectively and close deals, how to figure out which industry your art is best suited for, how to correctly invoice, industry mistakes you should avoid, and more...
This means you will be fully prepared to find and secure the right opportunities that will fulfill you creatively and pay you fairly.

How To Land Your Dream Art Job
For some of you, landing that nice prestigious illustration job at a famous company like Disney, Riot games, or DreamWorks is your dream. In this guide you will learn how to network effectively, how to get yourself & your art noticed, how to nail an interview, and much more.
This means that you will have a competitive edge over all the other illustrators out there trying to get the top jobs in your industry.

How To Get Freelance Work
For those of you looking for the thrill of freelancer life, I've got you covered. You will learn how to get the best freelance work, how to get your work discovered to attract more clients, how to correctly structure your portfolio, best practices to follow as a freelancer, and more…
This means that you will be able to create the freelance work-hard/play-hard lifestyle you want, earn a living, and still have time for conventions and games.

How To Create Your Own Brand
As artists, what we want most is to be known for our accomplishments and abilities. In this guide, you will learn how to combine your talents and establish your own personal brand; what it takes to get your brand off the ground, and how to get your brand to scale.
This means you will have the groundwork to expand your influence so you can gain the recognition & wealth you desire.

How To Create Your Own Products/Services
Some of you have always wanted to create your own games/products/services and sell them online via Kickstarter, Shopify, or Amazon. In this guide, you will learn how to start your own line of products/services, how to fail fast & improve, and how to sell your products/services profitably.
Understanding & applying the lessons from this section means you will be on the fastest road to 6+ figures.

How to Develop The Successful Illustrator Mentality
You will learn how to think like a successful illustrator and see the world as yours to make & create. You will develop a growth mindset that will enable you to try hard things and accomplish great feats.
This means that you will be able to see opportunities that you weren't previously able to see and you'll have the courage to reach out and grab them.

And so much more...
 How you are going to get the biggest bang for your buck by backing this guide today. 
30+ years of experience, industry insights, and advice from 13 award winning illustrators who have all been in the trenches and climbed to success; the information in this book is worth thousands. You could spend an entire academic career at an art university and still not even come close to learning the gems that are in this guide. 
Luckily, this isn't art school so you won't have to take out student loans to get access to this valuable information. For this Kickstarter only, I am going to give you access to a massive discount. 
I'll give you one copy of "What They don't Teach in Art School" for the price of $29 for a soft cover or $39 for a hard cover. 
The invaluable knowledge of how to monetize your art skills and craft your own successful career all for a fraction of the cost of student loans, housing, text books, and Tuition. This deal lasts only for the duration of the Kickstarter. It will go back to full price afterwards. Claim your guide at a massive discount today!
Soft Cover
Hard Cover


So What? Why should I care? 
The vast majority of artists out there have the art skills to earn a living, but they have no clue how to monetize their skills; so they starve. Artists just assume that if they don't have any opportunities to make money with their art now; they will never have any opportunities in the future. This is false. They just lack the understanding of how to apply their art.
What They don't Teach in Art School gives artists the edge they need to go out there and make a successful career for themselves. 
If you personally apply the principles in this book:
* You'll learn how to establish a career where you are both earning a living and creatively fulfilled.
* You'll learn where to spend your time to get your career off the ground and save a lot of money in the long run.
* You'll skip past mistakes and obstacles that inexperienced illustrators make in the industry today.
* You won't have to listen to that naysayer in your life, you know the one, and instead you'll take life into your own hands.
* You'll be recognized for your own content and your own brand.
* You won't have to be afraid of the future and instead look at it as your oyster.
Fear is a tough thing to shrug off. It paralyzes you from head to toe; preventing you from taking the necessary steps towards success. The greatest source of fear is the anxiety of not knowing how your future will play out. But let me clue you in on a secret, the future is yours to decide. You have what it takes! Decide to make your future a bright one. I wrote this guide to help illustrators, like you, to succeed in the most challenging time of your life. It's going to take work, there are no shortcuts, but there are open highways.
- Will Terry

Shipping & Fulfillment
Both soft & hard cover books are ready to be printed!
Books will ship to the United States & Internationally. You will not pay for shipping until after the completion of the Kickstarter during fulfillment  (estimated to be in October). I will be using Backerkit to help me with fulfillment. Backerkit makes fulfillment quick and easy! I will not mark up shipping whatsoever, you will only pay what is fair.  
When we are ready to ship the books (probably in October) you will receive an alert to complete a survey (to be sent to the email address that you provided with your pledge). That survey will ask for your current/updated mailing address to ensure that your order will arrive to you directly. You will pay for shipping at that time -AND- GREAT NEWS: YOU WILL ALSO HAVE THE OPTION TO ADD MORE COPIES TO YOUR ORDER AT THAT TIME! You'll also have the chance to purchase add-ons, such as other books and prints by Will Terry.
If you have any further questions, feel free to ask me personally.

campaign.story:
I want to help aspiring artists, of all styles and all ages, become the artists of their dreams with this super affordable alternative to art school. 
Hi, I'm artist Jason Brubaker and Cognitive Drawing is a learn-to-draw workbook unlike any other you've seen.
This workbook solves a difficult problem: How can artists learn to draw anything quickly if they don't have access to art schools or the money to pay for an art education?

I've spent 3 years developing this workbook to accomplish that goal and help you become the artist that you want to be!
We are printing the book on high-quality-sketch-book-paper perfect for drawing with pencil. 
Cognitive Drawing will be designed to fold flat on your drawing table just like a sketch book. 
How did Cognitive Drawing Start?
When I was a kid I discovered a method to teach myself how to draw anything from memory. Later on I learned that this method is similar to what cognitive research has called "The Testing Effect". 
Studies have shown that The Testing Effect is one of the most efficient ways your brain retains new longterm information and this book was developed using these same scientific principles.
Cognitive Drawing has had over 1300 Beta Testers which have included Homeshoolers, Charter Schools, High Schools, hobbyists and those who just wanted to expand on their college educations. 
Of those testers 90% saw an immediate improvement in their drawing AND retained what they learned.
 LINK: Four Page Cognitive Drawing Sample PDF (Download)
Better yet, here is a demo video if me doing the sample PDF!
Over the course of 90 days I'll be teaching you the techniques that have made me a successful artist. 
With Cognitive Drawing learning to draw is as easy as... 
What are Students Saying?
Whether it's for personal use, homeschooling or the education system. Give Cognitive Drawing a try and see why families around the nation are calling it "The best way to learn to draw!"
SHIPPING
We will be using Floship for the fulfillment of this project.
"This project's logistics plan has passed a thorough 7-point review and Floship certifies that we have an efficient and reliable logistics plan to deliver this good from the factory to you, the customers."
See Floship certification and information here: https://certification.floship.com/c/cognitive-drawing/

campaign.story:
Hi, I'm Jake Parker, an independent artist based in Arizona. I specialize in comics, illustration, and designing characters, robots, and machines. You may also know me from Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, or as the creator of the popular online art challenge: Inktober. 
It's been 3 years since my last art book and I thought it was high time to make a new one just for you! 
The book will be beautifully printed by a 4 color offset printing press. It will be a softcover, perfect-bound book that will fit nicely with the other books in the DRAWINGS series. It will hold a comprehensive collection of both finished and exploratory artworks from the last three years, including an exclusive SKULL CHASER comic made especially for it. There will be a step-by-step tutorial on my drawing process as well.
This is the FIFTH book in my series of DRAWINGS art books and I felt it was time to mix things up a bit and change the nature and design of these books for the next several publications starting with DRAWINGS 5.
You can order these books right now from my shop. If they're out of print, I have a digital download option available.
Along with the book there's a bunch of other stuff that is only available from this Kickstarter. I'm excited to make these things and get them out to you!
Note: this is a living, breathing project. All designs are pretty close to what I would like to produce, but are subject to change.
 Note: "ALL The Extras" now includes the bookmark set as well!

The book is getting made! YESSS! And now we're shooting to add these stretch goals to your book - at no extra cost to you!!

My team and I are shipping from the US, so apologies for the high cost of shipping to countries outside of North America. We're charging *exactly what it costs us* to ship from the USA. So if you live in London or Sydney or Berlin, shipping prices are what they are. If we can find an affordable way to ship to you we will use it, and keep you updated here.
All rewards will be sent out at the same time (both signed and unsigned). However, if there is a very high number of backers, please keep in mind that it will take us a few days to work our way through packaging all the rewards. 
Unforeseen delays that are out of our control can occur during delivery, so please allow an additional two weeks before checking up on your package. We will be doing our best to make sure everything gets to you on time!
Sometimes orders get lost or damaged in the mail. In that case, we will work with you to make sure you get your book. For instance, if your book is damaged, please contact us and we will have you return the damaged book for a replacement. We are not responsible for lost packages marked as "delivered." 
It's Kickstarter season, and that means a few friends of mine are also running Kickstarters right now. If you like what I'm doing here, you might also like these projects. 
All of these creators I know personally and know that they supplement their income with conventions and with the situation right now none of us are sure if selling at shows will be an option this year. Just a couple bucks from a bunch of people could make a huge difference for these projects.  Go check them out and throw some support their way!
Derek Laufman's Creations
Creations Vol 1 is Derek Laufman's first art book entirely comprised of original designs. The book will be jam packed with hundreds of illustrations, beautifully displayed across 100 pages and 7.5 x 10" in size with a soft cover. This book is for all ages showcasing character designs, concept art, and visual development. With full color illustrations, rough sketches, traditional ink and ink washed artwork. It's a great book for professional artists, art directors, aspiring creators or just fans of art and pop culture. Printed In CANADA LINK
Dave and Fred's Story/Line
From my friends Fred Shroeder and Dave Kellet comes one-on-one interviews w/ artists from comics & animation, talking about their craft. "Art and Stories and the Art of Telling Stories." I was one of their "test" interviews and I think it's a great platform to learn about the craft of comics, while also elevating the art form. LINK
Sketch Wallet's Little Sketchy
Introducing Little Sketchy - A Sketch Wallet for Kids! It’s a wallet with a pencil and replaceable sketchbook inside.The sketchbook is filled with tips, prompts, activities and more to get the creative juices flowing.  It comes in two styles designed by Parker Jacobs and Ralph Thomas. Our goal is to make drawing fun and to build great sketching habits. It also comes with an Artistic License which means you can do whatever you want in the name of art. Don’t want to clean your room? Bam! Just flash your license! Check out the Kickstarter: LINK
Beorn: The Littlest Viking Saga
Ben Bender, a freelance cartoonist who works mostly with all-ages and kid-friendly art and stories, is making BEORN: The Littlest Viking Saga! LINK
I just wanted to thank everyone who has supported my projects over the years. I love drawing, and I love making books. I can't believe that I have enough support from people like you to get to do this for a living. It really is a childhood dream come true.
Thank you for your interest in this campaign. I hope you think this deserves to exist and will consider backing the project to make that a reality.
Thanks,
Jake

campaign.story:
Little Sketchy™ 
A Sketch Wallet For Kids (and adults that refuse to grow up)!
We've created a Sketch Wallet with kids in mind. Building good drawing habits and making sketching fun is the goal of our latest creation.  
 The wallet is 3.25 x 4.25" and is made of high quality printed vinyl. The inside has an ID window pocket, a card pocket, and a money pocket for your cash. Each wallet comes with a small pencil and a 2.5 x 3.75" replaceable sketchbook filled with drawing activities to prime the creative pump.  
Many parents have asked me how to keep their young artist going. I believe they should provide them with a few things: 
"Encouragement" will need to come from you, but we can help with the "fresh art supplies" and "inspiration" to make drawing fun and accessible. Each wallet comes with a replaceable sketchbook filled with tips, prompts, activities and more to get the creative juices flowing. Your artist will definitely come away with new skills and fun stuff to draw. There are also plenty of blank pages that will allow unguided creativity. Our small blank, toned, dot-grid and lined books also fit this wallet. 
Many artists don't begin to carry a sketchbook until they hit college age or older. Help the young artist in your life to develop this habit early, it will only help them get better. Drawing at a young age should only have one goal...it should be fun. You'll have plenty of opportunity to dash their hopes and dreams later. Don't get hung up on, "you drew the head too big," or "the perspective is all wrong." Criticism before they're ready will squeeze the love right out of it. If they can keep drawing through middle school and into high school then they are probably ready for honest critiques. You'll know because they'll ask for it.
We've had this on the idea board for a couple years and thought it was time to make this thing. We have been trying several designs, interviewing young people, measuring pockets, checking out materials and so on. We love the final designs and know you will too. 
 The first wallet was designed by the ever-doodling Parker Jacobs. Parker has been posting his daily doodles for the past decade. You may recognize his work from Paul Frank Industries, Yo Gabba, Gabba, The Aquabats and Goon Holler. Parker has a bad habit of letting his domain names run out.
 The second wallet was designed by Sketch Wallet creator Ralph Thomas. He's proven that even a mediocre artist can make a living in illustration and has spent the last 10 years as a game artist. When he's not drawing he's found riding his trusty green bike, "the Bass-O-Matic™" or stealing Parkers websites (Exhibit A, Exibit B).
Special Thanks to Miles, Raegan, and Aaliyah :-)

campaign.story:
The Dice Tower:
This dice tower was designed by our in-house designer here at GameTank to use during our late-night game sessions. It was so useful and attractive that we felt it deserved to be launched as a set people could purchase for a reasonable price. So we reached out to our manufacturer and worked with them to create this set.
So, who are these guys?
We are a group of toy developers, game designers, and brick enthusiasts that want to bridge the gap between bricks and tabletop RPGs. We have a lot of experience in toys and manufacturing and want to use those connections and knowledge to create awesome sets to enhance your game. Our first set will be this dice tower, then we move onto sets that support the most popular campaign settings and modules.
What will happen now that the Kickstarter is funded?
After we receive funds, production will begin. The smallest order we can place for a product like this is 1000 sets. This will take 1 month for the factory to complete. Then they will be shipped in a container to our warehouse in the US, this will also take 1 month. Then the warehouse will ship all of the orders out to your addresses.
After we fulfill the Kickstarter, we will launch our eCommerce site where people will be able to place orders for this dice tower and future sets.
 Future sets? 
Yep, we already have a few sets lined up for release after this one. The next set will be around 1500 pieces and feature a campaign with 3 sessions worth of play. We will continue releasing new Dice Towers through our website, but our primary focus will be sets with full campaigns.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When we receive funding (two weeks after the end of the Kickstarter) we will begin production with the manufacturer. Most of this process is already taken care of. They understand our design, and have all of the printing and molding machines ready to go. 

Once the product is manufactured we need to get the product all the way from the manufacturer overseas to our warehouse here in Chicago. The product will the be delivered in a large crate on a ship, and arrive at our warehouse 30 days later. 

Then the warehouse will organize the product and ship it out to all of our backers. 

We hope to have everything done by February, but sometimes plans go airy, and logistic issues arise that slow down the process. We will do everything we can to keep everything running smoothly, and post updates every week about the progress.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Game Chasers' Motion Picture is a freaking AWESOME fictional adventure following Billy and Jay as they go on the road to track down a childhood gaming relic. If you are a fan of 80's/90's road trip movies and retro video games, this movie is for you. It will capture those warm memories you have for gaming and remind you of those good times while making you laugh along the way. This will be a movie you can watch with the whole family. For fans of the Game Chaser's web series, this is not a 2-hour game chasers episode, it is a feature-length scripted comedy film. However, it will have everything you come to love from the show at its roots, just presented in a new and exciting way!   This will be a different format, of course, from the show (which is reality documentary style) But that's the point, to do something fresh and different!  
We've had an idea to do a movie for a long time, but it wasn't until someone approached us with the concept of a scripted comedy that the light-bulb went off. Our original idea a few years back was a country-wide road trip going to flea markets. Basically exactly what we do on the YouTube show, still keeping it a "reality format", and making it a feature-length movie. And while many might find that idea awesome, I found it boring. It's the same thing we already do just.....longer. And we have to depend on the chance of actually finding games. You wouldn't see Mevor, or Dodongo in it because or work obligations as well. For me, that idea just wasn't exciting. We never pursued it. We never tried to Kickstart it. Maybe we will down the road, but this idea that we have is so much more stimulating creatively for all of us, and a nice breath of fresh air. And the great thing about it for fans is that even though it's a fictional narrative, it still has the essence of the show. It's a refreshing take on Game Chasers. And we are super excited to bring it to life and show the world. 
Now, some people might be concerned over the fact that we have a Producer and that that means someone else other than us is calling the shots. Nothing could be further from the truth. This is OUR project, OUR vision, and the idea and direction is 100 percent OUR creations. We make the decisions. No one controls us, ever. They work for US, not the other way around. I just wanted to ease anyone's concerns that someone else was in charge of this project. This is GAME CHASERS only bigger and badder! What you love about the channel, you will love about this. 
The plan is to shoot over the Spring/Summer and have it ready for release in 2020. There will be a limited theater run, at the minimum here in DFW. But there will also be digital downloads and Blu-rays as well! In the meantime the regular YouTube show isn't going anywhere, so don't worry.  

What's it about????
Well....I can only say so much. A lot of what will make it awesome to see for the first time is the big surprise we have in store. That's good enough, right??? RIGHT? NO? Fine......I can give a quick synopsis, I suppose...... Billy and Jay go on a road trip to track down a childhood gaming relic. And of course...a ridiculous adventure ensues.....a ridiculous adventure but not TOO outside the bounds of reality. Its main purpose is to be FUN to watch but also make you feel good!
Think of this as a fictionalized Game Chasers Prequel. A fun re-telling of how 2 friends became game collectors. 
It will be what you have come to love about the show mixed with stuff you would have never expected, but still fitting in with the spirit of what we do. And also mixed with bigfoots and aliens. Maybe. ;)
PLAY


Ok, how about this? How about I list some words that are out of context but have actual meaning in the movie. Yes, Im a tease. 
Mountain, NES, Shotgun, Campfire, Star Fighter, Gnome, 1988, Flea Market, Lemmy, Battle Toads, Rental, Motorcycle, Gaiden, Photograph, Basement, Drone, Trunk, Punchout, Tetris, Jarr, Abandoned. That's all you get. For now....
For another tease...scroll to the bottom and see a page from the actual script. 
This is just a teaser paying homage to Gremlins, not any official art
In this video we go into the story a little more to hopefully help you understand the theme of what its all about.  
Many of the Game Chasers show fan's favorite episodes were ones that made them both laugh and cry, and this movie will capture that same feeling. You will laugh, cry, cheer, and reflect. Fans of the web-show will get enjoyment out it, as well as those who are not familiar. Its a movie for fans and newcomers alike.  
 I (Billy)  have a passion for storytelling. I have enjoyed making the Game Chasers web series and will continue to do so, but my favorite projects have always been the ones where I can tell a story and or just be creative. The Under The Bridge Game Chasers Episode and our cartoons display that the most, I believe. This movie has been in the planning stages for a while now, but we feel it's finally time to move forward with it.  
Your support right now of this Kickstarter is critical for it's success.
 Making a movie of this magnitude is expensive. As I said, this isn't a 2-hour Game Chaser episode. This is not us just taking a camera and going out a few days a week shooting video. We have a producer. We are hiring a professional film crew for this. We want this to be like any other movie you would see in a theater. THIS IS NOT a normal "web series makes a movie" scenario. Our goal is to shoot this movie on a RED Camera. A RED camera was used in Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2, to give you an idea of the quality. I DEMAND that this EXCEEDS your expectations.  We have always reached for the best quality in everything we do, and this is no exception. But besides the film crew, there are so many costs that go into this such as, location costs, insurance, paying the cast, props, transportation, post-production, CGI, licensing, lawyers, to name a few. We will need to hire people to do jobs such as accounting so we don't get sued or have the IRS come after us, a production manager so they can organize the dozens of people need to work on this and keep things on schedule, and also the cost of simple things like food for the crew that will add up quick. Luckily I (Billy) will edit so we can save money on that. As you can see, things add up quickly. 95k may seem like a lot, but in movie making terms 95k is still low budget. Remember, this isn't us filming on the fly at the flea market, this is a REAL production.   
This is a Pre-Sell. 
We hope to Pre-Sell enough copies of the movie to cover the costs of making. If we don't, and our goal is not met, then Kickstarter will not charge your card. 
WHY CROWDFUNDING?
Crowdfunding, or "Eat Bacon" as some would call it, is the best way to for us to bring this movie to you. Lucky for us, it's the year 2019 and the film industry has changed so much. There isn't a need to get a studio's backing or get deep pocket investors. We cut out the middle man and allow our product to be funded by the PEOPLE who want it DIRECTLY. The thing is, investors, dropping large sums of money will want a say in the movie, and rightfully so. We want to keep 100 percent control. We have TURNED down an offer for a TON of money from a potential investor because they wanted to make changes.  Our vision is important to us. With that said, we HAVE been able to secure smaller funding from a few sponsors who won't be taking any control. It's not a ton of money, but it helps, and we are always looking for more small sponsors who don't want say in the movie making aspect. 
Obviously, we have always been great at taking low budget and making it look high budget. It's been our MO since we started. 
Reminder: You wont be charged unless we hit our goal
Of course, there are going to be people waving their finger saying we should get investors instead of going directly to our audience who would want to see this movie to fund it. They say we E bacon? With that said, we actually DO have some! As it stands we have around 7k committed from sponsors. However, you can play a huge part in making that higher. IF you guys help fund this now and early on in this campaign, more sponsors will be willing to jump on board since they will see there is a ton of interest and will be way more willing to get involved. However, they still wouldn't be sponsors who would get a say in how we make this movie. If so, we will turn them down. So if you want this to happen, let's do it as soon as you can! Let's show the people what the Chode Nation is all about!
We more than likely not make any profit off this. And we have no plans to pay OURSELVES for the work. Kyle Newman recently said he made nothing off the movie Fanboys in the end. I can see that happening with us. This is a passion project, but even passion projects require funding. If you want to see this movie made let's pull together an make one hell of a movie! 
Here is a pie chart that will show (generally) where the money will be spent. This as of now is a best guess, some areas could end up being cheaper, others more expensive.
Here are a few further breakdowns of what you saw on the graph, and why exactly we need them. These are the jobs/things we will actually have to pay for and not get the "friend" hook-up.
Production Manager - This person handles the business side of things. Like managing the budget, making sure people get paid, employment issues, paperwork and etc. 
Cinematographer - Behind the director (Billy and Melvor) this is the most important crew member. He or she is responsible for the look and cinematography of the movie. We can't do everything, so this person is vital for us. We want to hire someone who knows what they are doing, a professional. This will obviously cost but will be worth it. We want the movie to look good! But beyond that, if we hire someone who is cheap and inexperienced we run the risk of them making a mistake, and a mistake on a movie set can cost thousands of dollars and days of shooting. 
Audio Tech - This person is responsible for recording the audio on the set. Again, if someone messes up this job it can cost money and time, so a professional is needed. 
Assistant Director - While the director and co directors focus on the actual movie making, the Assistant director does the important "dirty" work to free up the directors time. Such as breaking down the script and planning the shooting days, and making sure all the people who need to be on set a certain day are there. They find the best and most efficient way to organize the shooting days to save time and money. 
Set Building - This is a must, and an expensive must. Some of our settings will need to be created because finding a real-life location that we need will be near impossible. I wish I could go into more detail but I would be giving away to much of the plot. Let's just say we will need to create a set that looks like it's from 1988. Also, a few of our settings would be impossible to film in a real life location because there would be no space to fit a camera and crew, so one would need to be built with only 3 walls, so a camera crew could be behind the "fourth wall". All this would need to be built on a sound stage which we would have to rent out from someone. Plus add the cost for materials and people to build said sets.  
Film Equipment - The DP will have a lot of gear but we will more than likely need to rent more and that cost can add up quick. Things such as camera mounts for a car, jibs, lenses, and lighting. Maybe even another camera if needed.  
Location fees - When we CAN shoot in real outside locations rather it be a building, a town, or someone's house, it is rarely ever free. Someone, whoever owns it, will want to be paid. Believe me, we will try to find a place for free or cheap, but it might not be possible.  
Special Effects Tech - Sometimes its cheaper and easier to use miniatures instead of full size real life objects for a particular scene. Tons of movies use models and you never realized it. Apollo 13 and Avatar are two to come to mind, and we have one of the model makers who worked on those movies on board to work with us! He knows the art of the craft and how to make them look real on camera. We are talking professional half-scale and quarter-scale models, not little toys. Big difference. This will make our life SO much easier for a few things we have planned, but we still have to pay him. But it's totally worth it.
Actors - Some of the main actors will be friends, others will not. Regardless, we will still need to pay them. We can't ask someone to step away from work for a week, or a month, or even a few days for shooting and expect them to do it for free. We will also have a lot of actors who are not our friends...we will definitely need to pay them.... 
Flight/hotel -  This is another costly but necessary expense. We will need to fly actors and crew in and out all through the shooting phase. 
Catering - This is not in the pie graph but still important. You can't starve your actors or crew while shooting all day. Food will add up quickly. I hope they like Taco Bell...or bread and water...
Insurance/legal - I hate this one, but it's a must. We are treading new ground here. We have to do things on the up and up to protect ourselves. We can't afford to get sued if someone gets hurt on set. And an entertainment lawyer is a MUST on a movie. One product or logo shown might open ourselves up to get sued, so we need council to tell us what's off limits. 
CGI artist - I already mentioned this but we have an artist who has worked on the Walking Dead on board. Now when I say CGI I don't necessarily mean crazy CGI sets or creatures (for the most part), a lot of CGI you see you don't even know you...see it.. Like wire removal, or fixing a mistake in the scene. CGI is an amazing tool to have, especially when a lot of times its cheaper than just re-shooting a scene. Cheaper...but not free
Miscellaneous - This is everything else. Anything from fixing a broken piece of equipment, to gas for driving to a location.  On a movie set, something can always go wrong. An example would be as follows: We have scheduled a two-day shoot that's outside at a certain location. We have 12 cast and crew members that need to be there, and we have flights booked for everyone. The shoot day comes and then...it RAINS! We have to pay for two extra days of hotels for everyone and reschedule return flights. And some of those people might not be able to stick around after the rain to shoot, so we could have to re-shoot it a week or two later.Yeah, that would be a nightmare. An expensive nightmare. If we get more than expected out of this campaign, then this slice of the pie will get filled up even more due to the old saying, "what can go wrong will go wrong". 
CAMPAIGN FEES - Kickstarter's fees, together with the credit card processing fees, come to about 8.5% - 10%. At our goal of $95k that's up to $9,500. 
Check out the production team so far. It isn't just a bunch of chodes (for the most part), we have real industry people working on this with us! 


More on CGI With Yoshi
Here, Yoshi talks about a somewhat unknown use for CGI that can have a huge impact on storytelling. CGI isn't just for space battles and crazy aliens....for the most part.

Oh, one more thing..... 
Blu-Ray, and poster art not yet finalized
Blu-Rays - These are not cheap to produce. There is a reason most of the film kickstarter projects don't have this perk and the ones that do have them priced higher than a Blu-ray would normally be, it takes money away from your movie budget to make them. However, I know you most of you love physical media, so despite taking a piece of the budget away we are going to produce them for you! They will have exclusive stuff only found on the Kickstater Pre-order, so don't miss out! When we run out of these Blu-rays and print more to sell at cons and online well after the movie is out, they will be cheaper but have less content. So these are DEFINITELY the versions to get! These Kickstarter versions will have TWO discs with so much extra content. Plus...if you guys don't buy these now....we wont have the money to make the movie...
Artwork - The artwork on the BLu-Ray and shirts are just to have visuals for the Kickstarter and are not the final product. I plan on hiring an awesome artist to make the poster/blur-Ray cover and make it look super epic. 
So our goal of 95k is bare MINIMUM what we need to make this thing. We can make it awesome on that budget, however, we can make it even MORE awesome with these stretch goals!  WE will make the best movie we possibly can on 95k, but these goals are the key to taking things to an all new level. With this extra money we will do things like bring in a REAL famous actor or 2 for a cameo, add more complex scenes, bring in more people to help, and just overall add much more cool chodiness. Not only for the movie, but for the Youtube channel as well. Let's UNLOCK these stretch goals!

campaign.story:
Explore the Relicblade Volgelands with the Moldorf Expedition and the dangerous Lostwood Enclave.
Click through the image to jump into the Relicblade Community on Facebook!
In Relicblade, players recruit the ultimate squad of fantasy heroes or cruel villains as they battle over the fate of the world. Choose your path and gather the greatest warriors of the age to your cause! Enter a world of magical treasures, wonders, and horrors. Compete against rivals in the bitter struggle for supremacy! The rules are deceptively simple and easy to learn, but you'll immediately face deep tactical choices in this dynamic battle game.
This ambitious Kickstarter campaign includes two new faction sets and a campaign book packed with adventures, lore, and much more! New Faction Sets not only expand the game, but also offer a great entry point for new players as they enter the dreaded Volgelands!
Get the Volgelands campaign book, both of the new factions, and the Kickstarter Exclusive "Vandas Greycloak" miniature with the recommended Bold Adventurer pledge level! 
  Relicblade miniatures are cast in white metal for crisp detail.
The Volgelands Adventure Campaign Setting
The Volgelands is the first campaign setting for Relicblade, and the first in-depth exploration of the Relicblade world. The book centers on the region known as the Volgelands. The port city of Riverhold is the beating heart of these cursed lands where feral magic still hold sway. Founded on the divine principles of Justice, but controlled by a powerful merchant class. Riverhold stands at a crossroad, both as a center of trade and a symbol of hope. Adventurers seek out the city to find their path. From this indomitable city, brave souls set out into the Volgelands, seeking a new destiny in a dying world. 
This campaign book is packed with tons of great content. Inside you'll find:
Regional lore concerning the history of the Relicblade world, Riverhold, and the Volgelands.
Faction lore focussing on the Temple of Justice, the Lone Guard, the Battle Pigs, and the sinister Bone and Darkness.
Map based narrative quest lines.
Two dangerous new environments: the Scoured Plains and the Brackish Badlands
Six scenarios in addition to the narrative quest lines.
New wild monsters that inhabit the Volgelands
And optional campaign extras including Side Quests and more!
Just look at this awesome map. Now imagine leading your warriors on this dangerous quest!
There is so much great content in this book! It's a little crazy to focus on one particular aspect, but I can't just upload everything and say "SEE HOW COOL IT IS!!!" with crazy eyes. But look at this dope map! These map based quest lines are great narrative adventures with cool details that bring it all to life. I can't wait for you to play through them.  
Scoured Plains illustration two-page spread.
Also, now that the cards are all in color I may as well make the books full color, right? Here is a preview of the Scoured Plains environment two page spread. Kinda neat, eh?
Included in Adventurer Pledge and Above. Available as an Add-On during this campaign only.
To celebrate the launch of The Volgelands, I sculpted an exclusive miniature of Vandas Greycloak: the Torment of Dusk. Vandas is one of the cruel Dark Wanderers featured in the new book. This miniature will not be available for general release after this Kickstarter Campaign, so be sure that you don't miss out!
The Moldorfs come from a strange dwarven society deep underground. Utterly detached from the surface, these intrepid explorers set out to discover the truth about a mythical world... An "outer land" connected to an infinite "outer space". Though it is surely folly, a powerful hearthguard warrior and a razor sharp rogue join the Bibliothecary on this absurd quest. 
The Moldorf Hearthguard
A titanic underground world exists below our very feet. Immeasurable caverns spread into unknowable depths. Sprawling underground ruins extend into the shadowy abyss. It is from these depths that the Moldorfs emerge.
Moldorf society is ruled by warlords from opposing houses. These households retain an elite core of Hearthguard warriors. In the tight corridors in which the hearthguard fight, they favor the use of massive shields and heavy war spears. From behind their brightly colored and richly decorated pavises, these fighters force their foes into unfavorable positions. 
Tactically keen and lavishly equipped, the few Moldorf Hearthguard to reach the surface have quickly gained renown as formidable warriors.
The Shadowfoot
Shadowfoot belong to secretive clans. They are maniac rogues who stalk the shadowy depths with razor sharp daggers and dubious ambitions. In the complex political alliances between Moldorf houses, there is ample space for these shadowy agents. And though no household would ever admit to employing the Shadowfoot clans, a knife in the dark always has its place.
The quest to discover unknown realms promises both horrors and treasures. The opportunity to test their razor sharp skill is simply irresistible to these rogues. The Shadowfoot are ready to face anything the great unknown can throw at them, but is the greater world ready for them!?
The Moldorf Bibliothecaries
The Moldorf libraries contain countless manuscripts of the forgotten age. Arcane secrets were swallowed by the abyss and utterly lost. But so too, were the Moldorfs. Isolated from the powers that ravage the surface world, the Moldorfs learned magic from ancient texts. A strange wizard caste of librarians, or bibliothecaries, formed around the arcane arts. 
Without the otherworldly patrons or raw creative energy present on the surface, the moldorf studies have naturally emphasized illusion magic. Though illusory magic is far less destructive than other forms, it is no less potent as they manipulate the battlefield. Bibliothecaries sew panic and chaos with massive illusory horrors and dazzling visions.
As the bibliothecaries collected and studied arcane writings, a strange sect began to believe in the existence of a surface world. They insisted the writings were not simply myths, but that they contain a metaphysical truth about the cosmic order. Now, these highly influential illusionists have gathered other bold explorers to their cause. They set out into the unknown. Traveling ever upward holding the ardent belief that a greater world exists in the unknown beyond. 
Neutral Alignment Faction!?
The Moldorfs are a neutral faction. That means any player, good or evil, may add Moldorfs to their party! Isolated underground, the Moldorfs have somehow avoided the cosmic struggle between good an evil. While players must still choose their alignment, neutral characters may be hired by any warband.
Will you influence these strange subterranean explorers for good? Or will you manipulate them to serve your own selfish ambition? I guess we'll see... 
The strange Lostwood stands to the west of Riverhold. It is the source of countless mysteries and haunting legends. The forests shifting boarders mark the boundaries of a most savage wilderness. Lone Guard watches stand vigilantly at its edge. Deep within the Lostwood stands an ancient empire ruled by the exile of the city of the dead, the immortal king Al'Adindred. 
The Lostwood Enclave are a distinct faction who abide by the savage laws of nature. They are wanderers, protectors, and sages of the changed world. Though they are extremely dangerous, their souls are intimately tied to the advocate.
The Arboleth Sentinel
The arboleth are a powerful race of treefolk from deep within the mysterious Lostwood realm. They are slow to anger and deeply wise. Many proud generations have served the immortal king as peacekeepers. They are indomitable warriors naturally attuned with the will of the advocate. These singular beings are lawful, just, and frightfully strong. 
The Wild Elf Pathfinder
Pathfinders are profoundly talented scouts able to navigate the most bewildering lands. They are keen hunters with the senses that reach beyond the physical realms. The wild elves are secretive nomads as a rule, however the pathfinders routinely interact with the greater world. 
On certain foggy nights the Lone Guard are visited by these wanderers. They trade rare goods and exchange rumors before fading away as mysteriously as they came. There are even stories of pathfinders joining noble warriors on dangerous quests. The mist-like visitors lend their unearthly speed and stinging arrows to the righteous endeavor.
Wild Elf Druid and Cave Bear Form
The way of the Druid is a solitary existence. Druids are in communion with nature and abide within its savage laws. They take the shape of a wild beast and may spend years in this form without ever encountering civilization.
The shape of the mighty cave bear is among the most fearsome shapes a druid may choose. These powerful beasts can contend with the horrors and monstrosities that plague the land on equal terms. With tooth and claw these creatures are horrors in their own right.
DRUID CREDIT OPTION:
The druid and bear are original sculpts from the first Relicblade release in 2015. The druid cards have been out of production for the past year, but with the Lostwood set she finds her place in a faction set with updated colored cards. 
2015 to 2018
If you already own the Druid and Bear figures you can opt for $10 credit toward add-ons instead of getting duplicate copies of these figures. You will get the Lostwood set without the druid and bear figures, but still receive the updated druid cards and the new elf and treeman figures. You will have the option to select a credit in the survey after the campaign ends.

Choose your path and gather the greatest warriors of the age to your cause! Enter a world of magical treasures, wonders, and horrors. Compete against rivals in the bitter struggle for supremacy! The rules are simple and easy to learn, but players are quickly engaged by deep tactical decisions.
Behold! A disparate band of heroes set upon the path of the Advocate. A Moldorf Shadowfoot, Hellhound Berserker, Arboleth Sentinel, Cleric of Justice, and their Billman Companion.
Relicblade "factions" represent groups that exist within the world. However, when you enter the game as a Seeker you choose between the good or evil alignments and gather heroes or villains to YOUR cause! Players use their influence to recruit characters.
Will you be the fate that brings together a noble fellowship? Or will you bind wicked servants to your dark will!? 
A soldier pig, iguan poacher, ogre retiarius, dark watcher, and shild pig join forces on a dark quest.
Specialize your characters utilizing a vast arsenal of upgrade cards. Tactics, items, weapons, potions, and spells create the framework to customize your characters. Faction sets include a booster pack of cards with new characters and upgrades, so as each new set is released the options continue to grow with dynamic new list-building options. 
In the example below this Iguan Slaver has a combination of defensive and ranged attack upgrades, which shifts his battlefield role and greatly increases his survivability. This particular build includes cards from The Wretched Hive, The Lone Guard, and Adventure Gear card pack.
(some older cards were produced in black and white)
With the Seeker's Handbook campaign rules players construct a base and lead their characters on dangerous adventures to claim magical treasures. There are six scenarios, four environments, dangerous wild monsters, and rare treasures that pack each game with new dangers and unique challenges. The Seeker's Handbook is a wonderful source for limitless adventure. The Volgelands campaign book builds on the core rules in the Seeker's Handbook with tons of exciting new content. 
You can learn a lot more about the game and how it's played on YouTube! There are gameplay overviews, unboxings, and battle reports ready to consume! Ash and Owen of Guerrilla Miniature Games and Gaming With The Cooler played multiple full Relicblade campaigns on their channels. So check it out!
Choose the pledge level that's right for you. I try to offer pledge's suitable for a variety of hobbyists. From the ubiquitous PDF hoarder, to the much beloved completionist. To make things super easy I put the new stuff in one "kickstarter recommended level". 
The "Bold Adventurer" pledge level is the core level for this campaign. It's the perfect level for new and veteran players. With these two faction sets you will be well equipped to enter the dangerous Volgelands. However, players will still need the core rules found in the Seeker's Handbook. You may purchase the book as an Add-on or purchase the book or a pdf right away from Relicblade.com/shop
The Champion of Adventure pledge level will equip you with everything you need for a FOUR PLAYER RELICBLADE CAMPAIGN!!! Is $180 kinda expensive? Sure, it is for me... but it's EVERYTHING you need for up to FOUR players to enter a world of adventure. Good luck getting your gaming group started on a new tabletop miniature game for less :)
Now that you mention it, I spent that much on a single warband earlier this year... So I feel confident that this is an awesome value.
What's a Custom Character Card?
You tell me about a D&D character you used to play or any character you can imagine. Then I will do an original illustration of that character. But the fun won't stop there! I will also stick that character on a special character card and make up some sweet rules and stats for your them! The custom card will be your ideas collaboratively realized in Relicblade. You're welcome to create heroes, villains, relics, or monsters, whatever your heart desires.
You get the digital artwork and copies of your character card along with the other Legends from this campaign. All ten custom character commissions will be collected in the "Legends 4" booster pack. This booster pack will be an official expansion for Relicblade for players to collect and enjoy. The first three Legends sets were extremely popular, so don't miss out on being part of a new generation of legends! 
My sincerest hope is to raise enough money to produce the book and the two faction sets above. But as is Kickstarter tradition, I am happy to add a little wish-list in the form of stretch goals. There will be fewer than last year, but that's just because the core campaign has a heavy workload with an amazing book.
Stretch goals are a great way to boost the project outcomes as the budget increases. If we raise enough money to produce the new sets, then the money we continue to raise will push toward even more new content! Newly unlocked content will be available as Add-Ons once the goal is reached.
Guest Artist: Márk László
The Relicblade: Guest Artist Series RETURNS!! I'm honored to offer another excellent collaboration. As the creator of Relicblade I enjoy unbridled creative freedom. This privilege is granted by my generous Kickstarter Backers, so in this campaign I hope to extend the mantle of creative power to a guest artist! 
I love Márk's style. He and I share a lot of the same influences. His work has tons of character with a mystical edge. He seemed like the perfect person to take my old idea for the Flame Bearer (crazed-fire-wizard) and transform it into something surprising and unique. I'm really delighted with the sketches he's sent so far, and I'm confident we're going to make an AMAZING miniature together!
Card art by Mark Laszlo!
Here is the proposed artwork and specs on the type of shirt we'll be using. 
Volgelands monsters have great art.
The add-on marketplace is a way to add a few extra items to your pledge. That way you can rest assured you are getting all the Relicblade goodness you can handle. To "add-on" simply increase your pledge total to include your selections. Then make a note of your choice so you can let me know what you wanted when the surveys go out! (Pro Tip: email yourself with the note so you can search for it later.)
I highly recommend that new players pick up a copy of The Seeker's Handbook. You and a friend will be equipped to play a full campaign with this book and the Bold Adventurer pledge level.
The greatest testament to Relicblade is the amazing community on Facebook! 
Darkness force by Matt Lechtenberg
The group that has formed around RB is the best. They are kind, welcoming, and super talented! There are awesome battle reports, stunning paint jobs, and new friends waiting in the Relicblade Adventure Battle Friends. We have a forum available Here, too. But the facebook platform makes sharing photos and stuff super easy. So we tend to just use that the most.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have run three successful Kickstarter campaigns to create Relicblade and several expansions. It has been a truly amazing experience. Thanks to the support of backers from around the world I was able to create an extremely high-quality product and continue to run a fruitful business!

I take special care to finish as much as possible before coming to Kickstarter. I lean on my experience to set out a reasonable production schedule to deliver on time. The figures are sculpted and production is under-way. The cards are ready to send to the printer, but without the Kickstarter funds I can't afford to hit "go".

Delays are always possible. 3D printers may break, governments may topple, and trains may derail, but I am confident that I can deliver this product in good order.

Thank you for your continued support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Here's the layout for the medium Sketch Wallet
Here's the layout for the small Sketch Wallet
Your wish is granted! 
We've come out with two new smaller Sketch Wallets. Our original Sketch Wallet is 4x6 inches and the most requested feature since we came out with the canvas wallet was to make a smaller version. We've made not one, but two smaller versions. The medium wallet is roughly 4x4.5 inches and the small is 3.5x4 inches. We know what you're thinking, are they too small to draw or write in? No. The medium wallet sketchbooks are roughly 3.5 inches square and are great to draw or write in. Everybody loves to draw or take notes on Post-It Notes and these books are larger than those, plus the square format is great for posting to Instagram :-) The small Sketch Wallet books are 2.5x3.75 which are slightly bigger than a standard sketch card. It's a fun size to draw or write in while making it a great size for even a front pocket. Each version comes in black or brown leather or black or gray canvas. Plus we threw in a tweed version just for fun. Keeping our vegan friends in mind, we picked a herringbone pattern tweed that is made from cotton, not wool. The space for the pencil or pen is actually larger than our original size wallet opening up many possibilities for new tools to carry.
Medium leather wallets come in black or brown
Medium fabric wallets come in brown tweed, black and gray canvas
Small leather wallets coming in brown or black leather
Small fabric wallets come in brown tweed or black and gray canvas
 If you're new to Sketch Wallet...
Sketch Wallet is a great way to always have your sketchbook with you. Or if you're the kind of person that would rather take quick notes on good old fashioned paper, this is the best way to do that. These wallet-sized books aren't intended to replace your full-sized sketchbooks or notebooks but are great for sketching or writing on the go when inspiration strikes. I've come to rely on mine and can't live without it. 
PLAY

Small Sketch Wallet sketches by @kactiguy
PLAY

Medium Sketch Wallet sketches by @etheringtonbrothers

Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter is an amazing platform to see if people actually want what you're making before you waste a bunch of money making thousands of products and then see if people like it. We pitch it to the Kickstarter community and let you decide if it's worth making. Why should you pledge now instead of just waiting until it's available online? Kickstarter backers will have theirs first. We won't make them available to the rest of the world until the Kickstarter backers have theirs. The other big reason is this year we're throwing in a pack of refill books free with each Sketch Wallet. You won't be seeing this deal online. So if you want yours first and with a free pack of refill books, pledge now!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As much as I'd like to pretend there are no risks, there are. Things go wrong sometimes... but the good news is this isn't our first rodeo. We've successfully completed two Kickstarters to date and have delivered on time on every version of wallet except one, and that was only a couple weeks (not months or years) later than we planned. We've gone through the prototyping process and worked out any issues. We've worked with this factory for some time and know they can deliver on time as they have every time in the past. If things do go wrong we'll keep you in the loop every step of the way.
