campaign.story:
With Controller & Keyboard support!
Note: We wanted to create a short, digestible (ha) prototype where you can tackle some baddies and feature some basic combat mechanics. This is a work in progress, does not represent the final game and is subject to change. Any and all feedback is welcome - good luck, doctor!
PS. This build has only had limited testing and optimizations but wanted to give everyone something to sink their teeth into, so expect some bugs!
    Hi! We're the Thar Be Monsters team! Founded in 2015 by three AAA industry artists that wanted to create a game inspired by colorful and gross Saturday morning cartoons.
Our team has worked on a lot over the years, from indie to AAA -- including League of Legends, Darksiders 2, Enter the Gungeon, and Ori and the Blind Forest! We've been around the block before, and we've got a serious passion for making games.
Check us out in our team bios below!
  Blubber Busters is a 2D action platformer with an emphasis on frantic combat. Space whales have problems -- Lots of problems -- from bizarre bacteria to pesky parasites and everything in between, and they need your help! We're big fans of 90s-era combat platformers, and are especially inspired by games like Mega Man X, Metal Slug and the Metroid series! Blubber Busters is definitely snuggled up in that same blanket and we aim to make something that stands toe-to-toe with the greats.
Whales come to you for help, and who are you to turn them down? Pick your patient and get out there! Each afflicted whale effectively works as a single stage with its own set of problems and objectives you need to solve to help get it happy and healthy again. A whale with a stomach ache may have you trekking down into the stomach to clear out unwanted debris while dodging digestive acids, or a parasite infection may have you wiping out swaths of critters before taking on their queen!
Swap between crew members to tackle each situation. Switch to the more agile Eva to climb a wall, burn through barriers with Rudy's flamethrower or kick-start machinery with some juice from Emmett's defibrillators! Or just cycle between all of them to give infections a thrashing. There's no I in team, so get to know the whole crew!
Treating patients earns you cash! As you play, the whales who show up to your orbital "waiting room" will start exhibiting more and more acute symptoms; you'll have to quickly decide how to optimize your exploration for upgrades and needs for cash against the growing demands of your patients.
Deck out your crew! Enhance their abilities, making them stronger, faster, and more effective! Give their health a boost or add some pep to their punches.
Upgrades don't come free and some need to be researched! You'll even be able to research entire new abilities to help you do what doctors do best.
Upgrade your space station! Your run-down clinic can't function without a solid crew and proper resources! Expand to accommodate more patients or build a lab to analyze new infections and get an edge with the latest tech -- spend that down-time growing your space station from a gutted wreck into a thriving medical facility!
      Humans and space whales live in harmony among the stars. Why? Because we need them and they need us. The whales provide us with transport across the galaxy, access to resources and materials, and much-needed companionship and in return they only ask that we keep them healthy. For being such an ancient species living in deep space, they're not too bright and get themselves into all sorts of trouble.
Their docile and cuddly demeanors make for perfect company in the lonely expanse, so what kind of monster WOULDN'T do their best to make sure they're happy and disease-free?
Naturally, clinics have sprung up across the stars offering these magnificent beasts relief from whatever ails them in return for a number of goods and/or services. Usually cash.
A new mutation has started manifesting in the patients causing all sorts of aggressive behaviors in these otherwise sweet and docile space beasts. One by one, clinics across the stars have started to go dark. Rudy -- a lowly janitor -- was on break and missed all the murder, so he's all the poor whales have left!
Follow Rudy and his crew as they take on the burden of keeping these burdensome beasts healthy in a world packed with guts, eccentric aliens and quack doctors! As you race to save every patient that comes to your door, a sinister plot is unfolding... Good luck, Doctor!
       Help us go beyond the stars and expand our game's content, platforms and more!
  Swap that formal medical education for hands-on experience! Ethics are great and all, but you have a job to do. Your patients, lovable lummoxes as they are, don't just get sick from disease
They suffer from indigestion, cholesterol-caked blood vessels, alien head-colds, virus-ridden prosthetics, infected bowels, and even genetic disorders. Do what needs to get done, there’s no medical board watching over your shoulder in space.
  We're set to launch on Steam for PC, but with your help we can reach stretch goals that can get the game on other platforms like Mac, Linux, PS4 & Xbox One!
 Art style? Art style.
Early exploration of a mother parasite
Coming at you with 2D hand-painted comic-book-style graphics! Our art style is completely derived from the mind of our epic concept artist, Avery Coleman.
Avery's work is inspired by comic book artists like Joe Mad (creator of Battle Chasers and artist for various Marvel comics), which we think will give Blubber Busters a style and unique look all its own!
Final concept of a mother parasite
  Layers of 2D depth in a 3D world!
      All of our characters and enemies are 2D renders of animated 3D models. This gives us the freedom and speed of 3D animation while still harmonizing with stylish 2D effects!
Look at all that harmonizing
We’re extremely excited to announce that Chris Christodoulou - of Deadbolt and Risk of Rain fame - will be joining us to compose the soundtrack for Blubber Busters! He's coming at you with a pumping retro electronic sound that jives with our art style perfectly!
Chris has already been helping us set the tone for Blubber Busters, and we have three audio tracks that we can share!
          What are Add Ons?
Add Ons are additional goods that you can include with your pledge (plus shipping if needed) If you pledge a minimum of $15 - you can add any of the following to your pledge amount.
For t-shirt sizes & any additional info needed - expect a backer survey from us! Thank you!
  The Game
Get a digital PC copy (PC/Steam) of Blubber Busters! All backers at the $15 Resident Rank or above will be able to choose on which platform (out of the unlocked release platforms) they'll receive their codes.  
Digital Wallpaper Set  
A collection of desktop wallpapers featuring Blubber Busters' colorful cast of mis-adventurers and medical malpractitioners.  

Early Beta Access
 Play the game before anyone else! Help give our team feedback and make the game the best it can be.

Digital Soundtrack  
Get your ears ready for a digital collection of Christodoulou's amazing, completely original work for Blubber Busters! Delivered in .mp3 and .wav formats.  
Digital Art Book  
Art-lovers unite! Feast your eyeballs on this curated collection of art for Blubber Busters. Character art, enemy iterations, space whale designs, full page spreads of colorful rivers of bodily fluids - this book has it all!
Digital Sketchbook  
Get a glimpse into the artistic process and the manic mind that drive Avery's sweaty, shaking hands to push pen and ink across the page. A special selection of Avery's sketches and warm ups - Blubber Busters' style.  
Secret Game Area
Get integrated into one of the more untraveled sections of your space clinic! Everyone gets access, but you get to be a part of it.
Physical Softcover Art Book  
It's the art book... but you can hold it on your HANDS. In meat-space! Digital-world cyber-beings need not apply; this is only for us creatures of flesh and bone.  
Physical Hardcover Art Book - Signed -  
Like the softcover art book...but harder. It also comes with some signatures from the team! Limited availability in the Surgeon tier or higher.  
-Limited Edition- T-shirt  
If the horrors of middle school taught us anything, it's that being cool is being EXCLUSIVE, and what better way to exclude others than by all of you guys wearing this limited-edition Blubber Busters tee! Available only through the Kickstarter!  
Physical Box Copy of the Game (+ manual & OST)
The ultra-definitive version of the game. A handsome box containing a physical copy of the in-game manual and the OST CD! Feel its weight in your hands and make space on that shelf!  
Alternative Outfit  
While the other janitors are in their orange suits, you can stand out from the crowd! Choose the tier with the alternative outfit and show off your unique look - the staff will be so jealous.  
-Limited Edition- Figurine 
The ultimate collector's piece! A resin cast of one of the characters of the game that stands 8cm tall. Extremely limited quantity.
One-of-a-kind Art hand drawn by Avery Coleman
The only thing better than prints is original artwork! Own one of the original sketches by Avery drawn during the development of the game. (Pencil not included)
Name & Portrait in the game
There are tons of dead surgeons in space whales these days, but oddly enough not many with names... until now. You can be one of these dead surgeons with a unique story of how you died! 
Name a Disease 
The first disease ever named after a still living person! If that's what you want to name it... Work with our team to create a gross, silly and unique name for your disease to go down in history! *cough* 
Art Direct an Enemy Design
Join forces with the BB team as an Art Director for a day & help design a flesh devouring enemy for the game!
Become an NPC in the game  
What's more exciting than talking to an NPC? Talking to one that IS YOU! Become one with the lore or just mop up the floor. Work with us to figure out your place at the Orbital SVP!   
Breakdown
  As a funding solution, Kickstarter affords us the most independence, control, and artistic freedom. Most of our team is remote, but our core members will be moving closer to work under the same roof. We'll all be basically living in a small, hobbit-like commune scrabbling with one another for an extra flavor-packet for our ramen noodles. But we'll be making a game - a game that we really believe in!
This game is our passion project, and what you see already is the culmination of months of work through late nights, weekends, and some missed engagements. Most of us were wholly unpaid thus far - the others, paid out-of-pocket for their services by the core team. These out-of-pocket funds are starting to run dry, and so it's come to the point that if Blubber Busters is to become a reality, we need to focus on it - full time.
We strongly value being transparent and listening to our community - a great trait that we've learned from working at Riot. We want to make sure that our game is just as fun for us as it is for you, and we hope for your feedback throughout development to make that happen! 
 Budget 
                                                                                                                                                                                                              Please feel free to reach out to us through any of the above channels, and if all else fails, you can shoot us an email at info@tharbemonsters.net
   Special Thanks!
Shout out to all those that have helped us through our earlier stages of development - Alex Redfish, Kevin Culler, Priscilla Tsang, Khai Tran, Skylar Surra, Mike Ton, Terry Nguyen & Ai Tran.
& thank you to Koujaku for the Ferr2D tool!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest risks come from the fact that game development is sometimes unpredictable and when that happens scheduling can be effected.

Luckily, every core member of the team has more than five years experience working in game development and has seen at least one shipped title. We've been through the scoping and development process and we're confident that we've budgeted time appropriately given our funds. Should several designs take more iterations than previously estimated, we have several publishers and investors already courting us, so we're willing to entertain those options to ensure that the best game is brought to you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Our Indiegogo will be launching in less than 24 hours!  Around 12pm PST
We're super excited to launch our brand NEW DEMO & crowdfunder on Indiegogo 12.3.19! Help us spread the word & save the space whales one last time! 🐋✨

We've been jamming on a new demo if you been keeping up on other socials, and its finally time to try once more! But this time we want to give Indiegogo a shot. We have way more game to share that we think you'll love. All out of our own pocket, we're really happy with what we've achieved so far & getting your support one last time would mean the world to us when the time comes. In the mean time, ill leave this here  :)

Hey Busters!  
After a few meetings with our current timeline and progress, we've decided to make one final push back on the release of our alpha. We want to make sure to give you guys something fun to play, and not just an alpha that functions. Our final alpha release date will be this July. The good news is that we've got most everything in game, now it just needs some massaging! With this extra time, we'll be able to:

Hey Busters!  
Busting our butts as usual, we’re only a few weeks away from releasing the alpha build of the demo! When those are out, we would LOVE to hear your feedback on anything and everything (the good, the bad, and the bugs) so we can make sure the demo is as awesome as possible before it goes public.  
If you’d like to be part of the alpha release, please consider donating to our !

updates.update_userinfo: Update #28: First alpha build coming soon!
updates.update_content:
Hey Busters, it's been a loooong while & we're sorry for the lack of public updates.  
Since the end of last year, we've been working hard on gameplay so that we can finally get the new public slice released sometime in May! In the meantime, we'll be doing a few more dev streams (you can catch the previous streams from this past month with Paul on our Twitch!) and doing our best not to keep our heads down so we can keep sharing awesome updates with you.

Busters!  
We are so excited to finally reveal our newest NPCs in the station. The constructed siblings - Salt & Pepper!  
These two eccentric sisters handle the research and development affairs on the station, residing in the Research Wing. Having been raised around science their whole lives on the station, they’re both prodigies in their own right but they couldn’t be more different!

campaign.story:
We bring you a whole new set of fantastic female character models suitable for use with all manner of tabletop wargames and RPGs!
Since we have reached our funding goal before the campaign ended, we will unlock additional Babes for you to choose for rewards as we reach the amounts posted.
$26.500 - Valeria Ironwood is a true warden of the wood and protector to all of nature. When Valeria is unlocked she will be available as a Babes choice for the Bomb Kit and Detonator levels and as an Add-On for $8 each for your pledge.
________________________________________________________________
UNLOCKED - Shaeldareyth Bladesong will be available as a Babes choice for the Bomb Kit or Detonator and as an Add-On for $8 each for your pledge.
UNLOCKED - Anugrah the Deepseer - maestress of the cosmos. She channels the energies of the heavens and studies planetary alignments to foretell of coming events. Anugrah is available as a Babes choice for the Bomb Kit or Detonator and as an Add-On for $8 each for your pledge.
UNLOCKED - Ellie Tyson and Bz-R - is unlocked as a Babes choice for the Bomb Kit or Detonator level and as an Add-On for $8 each for your pledge.
UNLOCKED - Anvalla the Orc Forgemaiden would make a great companion for Maelee or to fill out your forge set with additional helping hands. Anvalla is available as a Babes choice for the Bomb Kit and Detonator levels and as an Add-On for $8 each for your pledge.
________________________________________________________________
Although we're using a term like "Babes" to describe the line, these characters are much more than just a label. The concept is something retro and nostalgic that is intended to evoke images of famous paintings like J. Howard Miller's "We Can Do It" and Rockwell's "Rosie the Riveter".
We have a fantastic list of classic character archetypes with a fresh take on the designs from the mind of concept artist Chris Walton for the core set as well as numerous stretch goals. Care is taken to size the figures so they are compatible with other models from the most popular manufacturers within the 28mm range of heroic sizes. Babes™ are cast in the finest lead-free pewter to assure as much of the detail of the original sculpt is preserved. All models are supplied unpainted and some assembly may be required.
Sculpts by Patrick for Reaper, Dark Sword, Privateer Press, and Bombshell
               Shepherd - sculpted by Chad Hoverter
        FUSE LEVEL - This backer level allows you to choose from any of the rewards available or unlocked, a la carte. This level does not include the "free" extra items added to the Bomb Kit. You will need to pledge additional amounts for them as a reward.
BOMB KIT LEVEL - You may choose which 6 Babes are included in your Bomb Kit from any of the ones listed in the BABES section. This will allow you to choose duplicates of the same Babe if you prefer. The Bomb Kit includes all of the FREEBIES shown here and may receive more as future items are unlocked.
DETONATOR LEVEL - You may choose which 13 Babes are included in your Detonator from any of the ones listed in the BABES section. This will allow you to choose duplicates of the same Babe if you prefer. The Detonator level includes all of the FREEBIES shown here and may receive more as future items are unlocked.
  These items may be added at any backer level for the listed pledge amount shown. More items will be added to the available selections if they are unlocked as stretch goals.
    BONUS ADD-ON COMBOS
These are special sets or collections of existing Babes that you may select as a reward option for the additional pledge amount shown and are offered to Kickstarter backers at a special promotional price. We will be posting these periodically over the course of the funding campaign.
                  Sculptor - Patrick Keith has contributed work all across the miniatures industry including top companies like Reaper Miniatures, Dark Sword Miniatures, Privateer Press, CMoN, Avatars of War, and over thirty more.
Sculpted by Patrick Keith
Sculptor - Chad Hoverter is best known for his renditions of the critters in Mice and Mystics. He has some critters in the Bombshell range along with a couple of Babes and we are happy he has been able to help with this current project.
Artist - Chris Walton is probably best know for his iconic character designs on games like WARMACHINE® and HORDES® as well as designs for Z2 Inc, Forrest-Pruzan Creative, Sodapop Miniatures, Paizo Publishing LLC, Exato Game Studios, Reaper Miniatures, Antarctic Press, Atlantis Studios, Eos Press, and Scrambled Eggz Productions.
Artist - Mary Profitt knew as a child she wanted to be in the creative field and started painting and drawing at age three. During high school she won three Gold Key awards at the national level and went on to study fine arts in college. Being blessed with a natural talent she has done commission work in portrait oil painting, pencil drawings, and painting in acrylics, so miniature painting was a natural fit.
Painted by Mary Profitt
  Artist - Elizabeth Beckley-Bradford is a professional miniature artist living with two cats, three dogs, a lizard of unusual size, and her husband, who puts up with paint brushes sitting around the house. She's been painting miniatures for several years and loves bringing miniature characters to life. There's nothing better than sitting down to a game of D&D with some wonderfully painted mini's to vanquish evil monsters!
Painted by Elizabeth Beckley-Bradford
  Artist - Matt DiPietro is one of the most prolific miniatures painters working today. He started his career as the lead studio painter for Privateer Press, and shaped the painting of Warmachine and Hordes for nearly a decade. These days he makes his living teaching the next generation of miniature artisans, and creating miniature art for private collectors.
Painted by Matt DiPietro

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Why return to Kickstarter? We have all of the models shown ready to go into production, but molding and mastering, and casting runs are expensive. It would take longer for us to raise the funds to put all of these models into production over time than if we ask for funds to make a collection of them at once. We want to get these models out to you as soon as possible, and Kickstarter can make that possible.

We have fulfilled seven prior Kickstarter campaigns and have experience with managing projects and handling production requirements. Bombshell Miniatures works with an exceptional print vendor providing only the highest quality digital printing technology when needed, and a molding and casting facility with over 50 years of resin and metal casting experience.

Delays may occur but every effort will be made to deliver your rewards in a timely manner with proven quality. We encourage you to examine our other projects as proof of our track record.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: WRAPPING UP FULFILLMENT

GOOD NEWS!
Valiant notified us that shortly we will have the remaining castings and all of the current rewards orders will be going out in May.
NOW IS THE TIME TO CHOOSE YOUR REWARDS

No you didn't miss an update, the previous post was not numbered.
What a hectic month it has been. All of March was consumed with prep for AdeptiCon and the show was spectacular. We had a terrific time and enjoyed seeing all of the folks who came by to visit.
Valiant has returned the resin intermediate castings of the final pieces and they are simply outstanding. They look exactly like the original sculpts in every way.

I have bored through the weekend to wrap up the remaining three sculpts for the Babes 3 project. Here they are. If you have not logged into the web store to place your rewards selections - NOW IS THE TIME!
Estimated fulfillment on the project was posted as June. But I wanted to do my best and have all of the sculpts wrapped up before AdeptiCon.
Save
Here is a quick video clip on the progress of the remaining sculpts. Anugrah and Shaeldaryth were wrapped up today after the video and more work will be done on Ellie this weekend.

WIP WEDNESDAY
 Hey all! It has been a rough start to the new year with the Bomb Squad being pulled in every different direction. But we are all back on track now. So, I have some good news and some bad news. Custom dictates I deliver the bad news first.
THE BAD NEWS

Hey all! Hope you had a great holiday season! We are back to work on lots of cool new things for 2017 and will be wrapping up production on the Babes 3 project shortly.
PLEDGE MANAGEMENT
If you have not yet selected your rewards options we encourage you to place your orders soon.

WIP WEDNESDAY
Still working on sculpts.  There will be another batch to send off to mastering at the end of the month.
Save

campaign.story:
Go to our HOME PAGE
  This is Ben Rodman, AKA Wizard Goose from RBJ Game Company. My task is to come up with new designs and concepts for our artists to work from. With the success of our first Kickstarter the stars have aligned for me to produce a good number of brand new designs. Bobby Jackson has sculpted some imaginative models for you this time around. Fortress Figures is again producing our figures so you know the quality will be top notch. Along with my brother, Jeff, and my sister, Ronda, we are reaching out to the miniatures gaming community to support our second Kickstarter Project.
For this Project we have General Aurora Salt, Robots, and several more specialists.  For our backers in the U.S.A, we also offer FREE shipping for pledge level ending the campaign at $50.00 or more.  
FREE U.S.A SHIPPING
  Stretch Goal Bonus
Metal Castings
White metal production copies of the new models from Fortress Figures. 
Production Copies
 Scale
Our figures are for the commonly used gaming scale of one inch is equal to five feet scale.  This makes our human figure 28mm from toe to eye or 30mm from toe to top of head if standing up.  It is our goal to keep our figures a consistent scale throughout the ranges.   See photo below for a size comparison to figures produced by other popular gaming companies.   
Scale Comparison
 Last Minute Add-On
Add On BDUs
Stretch Goals 
Our intention for this kickstarter is to add a stretch goal to each pledge of $50.00 or more as each funding level is achieved.  All backers at pledge levels of $50.00 or more at the end of the campaign will receive all stretch goal rewards included with their pledge rewards on fulfillment.  The stretch goal rewards will be awarded in addition to your pledge level and will be automatically included with your shipment when your pledge is fulfilled.  The stretch goal models shown are between 15mm and 25mm tall and will fit comfortably on a 25mm base that will be included for them.  All stretch goal reward models will be cast in white metal.   
Stretch goals by Bobby Jackson and Tim Hill
PLEDGE LEVELS
We have a variety of pledge levels to choose from including all new figures if you participated in the last kickstarter and don't need duplicates  and an ALL IN level if you missed the last one so you can catch up.   The $10.00 level is for the General Aurora Salt and her trusted genetically enhanced covert operative companion Sergeant Pepper.  It should be noted that this $10.00 level is not eligible for stretch goal rewards.   
         Add-Ons
If what you get in the standard pledge is not enough, and how could it be, you can add any number of additional models to you pledge as desired.  
Shipping
On the end of the campaign, each backer will be issued a coupon code via e-mail to redeem at our on-line shop for your pledge rewards.  This worked out very well last time around seeming to be the simplest way and also allows for some last minute additions if you desire.  Shipping fees are not included in the pledge level and will be collected at the time you redeem your coupon code.  
Estimated shipping fees:
U.S. $0 - $5  (U.S. receives free shipping for $50 or more pledges)
Canada $15
Other Destinations $20
Customs fees, duties, taxes, tariffs and or additional charges incurred at the shipping destination by the receiver are the responsibility of the receiver.  RBJ Game company cannot accept any responsibility for additional charges imposed by the taxing authority of the legal jurisdiction of the receiving residency.     
Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter has proven to be the best method to launch and expand a new range of miniatures.  Kickstarter has enabled a renascence in miniatures by allowing manufacturers to appeal directly to their fan base.  With the success of our last Kickstarter at more than double the funding level, we were able to have several more figures sculpted, printed and put into production than we initially planned.  The funding level directly affects the expansion of the range with our backers literally funding our efforts with their venture capital.  What better way to participate in creating the miniatures you want while supporting the hobby we love?
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There is practically no chance of this project not being fulfilled once the successful funding level is reached. Fortress Figures is one of the oldest professional miniatures production companies with more than three decades of experience casting the finest white metal miniatures and capabilities for casting several thousand figures per day. All molding and casting is done in house by our dedicated staff of three well experienced individuals. Only the sculpting and printing is outsourced and the sculpting portion of the project is already completed. We still have some 3D prints that need to be printed (the standing at attention guys and the stretch goal figures), a few master molds and a half dozen production molds remain to be finished before casting your figures can begin. We have again, allowed ourselves what we consider to be an extraordinarily abundant amount of time to complete this project. A quick look at our previous Kickstarter will show that we shipped rewards to backers a full three months ahead of schedule last time around. 

An unforeseen event, though unlikely, could be, well, unforeseen. Should anything go awry, I pledge to keep our backers up to date on any delays or scheduling changes that might occur so no one is left guessing about what is going on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
A quick note to let you know we have launched our third Kickstarter Project.  This one gives you the alien enemies of the S.T.A.R. Troopers.  The INFESTOR INVASION.  Please take a look.  We really appreciate all your support.  I'm amazed at how large the line has grown in such a short time.  All due to our backer support.   We couldn't do it without you.  
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1620164718/infestor-invasion

We have received some new artwork from Sean Sutter of Metal King Studios that I wanted to share.  We've been working with Sean on his projects casting him some metal so we thought we'd reciprocate and have him do some art for us.  He's also an excellent sculptor and I'll have some sculpts from him coming in the future as well.  You can see his art on our Kickstarter Preview still on track for launch on January 15th.

Quick update on what we're doing:
The 3rd Kickstarter for the INFESTORS has been delayed.  Our expectation is to launch the next project on January 15th.  You can see the preview HERE and make comments as you will.  I read them all and respond to most.  
We now have received our painted display from Chris Smith for the Sniper Team.  Given that we've delayed the INFESTOR kickstarter project launch to January, we've decided to go ahead and put this model in the store so you can get one now .  Don't hesitate to give us suggestions on what you would like to see next and we'll put it on the list of things to consider in for future planning.  We want to be responsive to our supporters.

For those interested in doing so, here is a link to the Infestor Kickstarter we're working on for you to look at.  We haven't reached a decision on a start date yet.  We had a delay getting the workers ready due to my last minute decision to make them smaller than the Warriors.    Bear in mind this is a work in progress.  Comments are welcome.  
Preview Link

We have sent all rewards for everyone that had their coupon/codes redeemed as of  Oct. 31.   You should already have your rewards or will have them as soon as the post can get them to you.  Any of you still to turn them in, we're getting those out in a day or two from the time we receive them so turn them in as soon as you can.  I think there are still a dozen or so still out not yet turned in.  If you have any trouble or questions about how to do this, be sure and send me a PM and we'll make sure you get your stuff.

We have mailed out all rewards for backers that have turned in there coupon/codes to date so if you have turned your is, you should expect a package very soon.   As soon as you get us your codes, we'll send them out right away.  Also a few from last KS project have not turned in their codes yet.  All coupon codes are still valid so turn them in as soon as you can so we can get you your rewards.

We have all the rewards for everyone that has turned in their coupons ready to ship as soon as Kickstarter transfers the funds.  That's about half of you.  If any one has any issues or doesn't understand how to claim their pledge rewards, please send me a PM and we'll get you on track.  
In the mean time, for your viewing pleasure, I just received a print for one of the new Infestor Larvae designs for a future project.  These were sculpted by Gene Van Horn.

Here is a shot from the downdraft table this morning.  This is stacks of the S.T.A.R. Trooper Light BDUs.  I believe this is the last of the castings we need to do.  These were  sort of a late addition to this project.

It looks like we're still waiting on Kickstarter to transfer the funds.  We're expecting this to take place early next week.  In the mean time, I thought you might like a peek at the first casting of an Infestor egg.   These will be available in our next Kickstarter planned for November.
Thought you guys might enjoy some photos of the Zombie Trooper available in the store now.  RBJGC STORE

Features
After finishing this video course you will be able to:

Design tiled overworlds
Program a character that can easily navigate the overworld
Incorporate complex in-game cutscenes with multi-page dialog boxes
Create beautiful room transitions
Control turn-based battle mechanics
Manage character progression with level-up system
And much more
Who is this Course for?
The ideal student for this course is someone who has used GameMaker before but wants to learn more advanced techniques. This course is not for absolute beginners to GameMaker. If you haven’t used GameMaker before, then check out my other courses first. This course is not easy. It will take a significant amount of work but it will also be fun.

Kickstarter?
Why am I here on Kickstarter when I have already created 3 successful courses without it?

This course is quite a bit larger in scope than my other courses. To help with the larger scope I’ve hired Toby Dixon as a contract pixel artist. As you can see from the screenshots, his art is amazing! I’ve been paying him using my business savings but I’m running low. I will be using the funds donated via Kickstarter to continue paying Toby as he creates the different worlds and animates the many monsters.

Also, a Kickstarter allows me to create a more flexible pricing structure before the course is placed on Udemy (see pledge tiers).


Thanks
Thank you so much for your interest in my course! Please consider pledging your support!

campaign.story:
Awful Fantasy: The Card Game is a competitive card game for 2-6 aspiring authors vying for the coveted goal of a finished story.
The game consists of two decks of cards, the awful deck and the fantasy deck, and a set of author cards.
In the game, each player takes on the role of an author and competes to be the first to play all three required fantasy cards for a finished story—a Protagonist card, an Antagonist card, and a Plot card.
To obtain the required fantasy cards to finish their story and win the game, players draw cards from the awful deck. These awful cards may allow you to draw from the fantasy deck, take a card from the discard pile, plagiarize by stealing fantasy cards from opponents, or even destroy an opponent's hard-earned story elements by killing off their Protagonist, poking holes in their Plot, or by de-antagonizing their Antagonist.
Read the rules here: Rulebook
Incorporating the unique and absurd humor of Justin and Mitchell Lucas (@AwfulFantasy), with gameplay designed by Adam and Brady Sadler (Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game), and featuring the art of Conor Nolan, Awful Fantasy: The Card Game is an awfully great blend of quick, elegant card play, beautiful illustrations, and absurdly hilarious fantasy satire.
                                                                         @AwfulFantasy is a comedy fantasy and science fiction social media account guided by Justin Lucas and Mitchell Lucas. Each tweet satirizes or parodies classic tropes and cliches in fantasy and science fiction writing.

Here's what some people have said about us:
  Awful Fantasy: The Card Game was designed to be simple and super easy to learn. Here's an example video for your first round of gameplay:
            The Protagonist, Antagonist, and Plot cards are each based on characters or events from popular @AwfulFantasy tweets. This allows us the opportunity to make sure Awful Fantasy: The Card Game is as silly and colorful as it can be.

Some of the tweets we've chosen are... weird (okay, most of them). It would most likely be a challenge for most artists to translate. We knew it was very important to find an artist who could not only capture the absurdity of our tweets, but to help us visualize the characters and places we come up with in a spectacular way. Conor Nolan does just that.
Conor Nolan is an illustrator based out of New York. From editorial illustrations for Vice Magazine, comic covers for Dark Horse Comics and Boom! Studio, and promotional material for MTV he has covered a varied range of clients and projects. Nolan's work can be seen on posters, apparel, comics, magazines, newspapers, beer labels, and record covers. And now, it can be seen on Awful Fantasy: The Card Game.
 
              (Conor's original line drawing for Gru'k. This is what the Original Line Drawing Level reward will look like)
    Every copy of Awful Fantasy: The Card Game will include all unlocked stretch goals.
            We've partnered up with established tabletop game designers, and good friends, Adam Sadler and Brady Sadler to make Awful Fantasy: The Card Game not only funny, but fun.
Adam and Brady Sadler have been working together creatively since before they could walk. This twin brother design team has worked together on staff at Fantasy Flight Games, contributing to game lines such as Descent: Journeys in the Dark Second Edition, Mansions of Madness, X-Wing, Gears of War, and Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay.
Their first published design together was FFG's Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game. Since moving on from FFG, the Sadlers have begun working with other publishers, both in the tabletop and digital world.

We're excited to have the help of such big influencers in the tabletop gaming world to really help make Awful Fantasy: The Card Game a funny, enjoyable gaming experience.
At the Adventure Level pledge tier and above, backers will receive The Dæmon Queen's Sæcret Tower, a very special Awful Fantasy roleplaying adventure specifically designed to be compatible with 5th edition Dungeons & Dragons!
Here's the story:
Once a regal and respected Queen of the Land of Orboz, Queen Fœtida instilled the opposite of fear into the hearts or her loyal subjects. Faced with the knowledge that she comes from a royal line rife with incest and illegal underground dragon fighting, Fœtida was dethroned by the Lord of a lesser house who uncovered her family’s darker past. Queen Fœtida, residing in an old, long abandoned sæcret tower in the Dargon Mountains, is now a servant of Necrosa, and has turned from her love of Contemporary Impressionism to the somewhat Darker Arts—NECROMANCY!
The Undead are invading the peaceful townships and cities of Orboz, consuming the flesh of the living, and ever spreading their vile dark magic and unpopular religious beliefs. Queen Fœtida has been spotted as a shade near the Dargon Mountains, and tale is told she still lives, most likely raising the dead as her own Personal Undead Army of Revenge!
It is up to a small band of heroes (you) to find Queen Fœtida and put an end to her Necromaniacal ways. In the Dargon Mountains lies the decrepit heart of the dark magic that plagues Orboz like a plague. In this metaphorical heart is where you must end the Dark Queen’s evil, vengeful plans (by killing her). Deep up inside The Dæmon Queen’s Sæcret Tower!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have great and trusted help in the design and production of this game. The biggest challenge is shipping all over the world and unknown quantities to ship. We've done our homework, gleaning this type of information from similar successful projects.

Our slightly higher Kickstarter goal not only pays for some absolutely amazing-quality art, but allows us to get the game manufactured in a great quality. In addition to manufacturing, this cost allows us to use a highly-rated fulfillment company to ensure that our projects will be delivered in a quick, and professional manner. We can't pretend to know how to ship hundreds of games around the world on our own, so we will make sure it will be done by the experts.

We're confident we can, and will, deliver a great product in a timely manner to our backers.

We know Kickstarters can get out of hand with rewards and stretch goals. We're focusing on creating a quality product, with rewards and goals that fit with the game and allow us to make pledging worthwhile to backers while ensuring rewards are fulfilled on time.

campaign.story:
S.T.A.R. Troopers
This is Jeff Rodman, AKA Ironrook from Fortress Figures, and I have made miniatures all of my adult life. I generally work behind the curtain for other miniatures companies but now it's time to step from behind the curtain and create some pet projects I have had rolling around in my head for some time. Along with my brother, Ben, and my sister, Ronda, we are reaching out to the miniatures gaming community to make our first Kickstarter a success. We're confident that with this first success under our belt, we will continue to realize additional great products that could not have been possible without you.
To get the ball rolling, we have a set of S.T.A.R Trooper miniatures. The core set of 5 poses is already done and ready to go. These miniatures were designed by my brother Ben and the 3D sculptures were brought to life by veteran sculptor Bobby Jackson. The molding was done by me at Fortress Figures and personally hand cast by us.

Miniatures provided are not painted.  Slotted plastic base provided for each miniature not textured.  Miniatures produced in spin-cast white metal or spin-cast resin.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have been manufacturing the highest quality miniatures for more than 3 decades. There is practically no chance of this project not being fulfilled once the successful funding level is reached. The Core set is already done and ready to distribute. The greatest risk may be a delay in creating the new poses if funding levels go high enough. Ironically, that means that the more successful the project, the more likely we may not meet the shipping dates. We have allowed ourselves what we would consider an extraordinarily abundant amount of time to finish completion of the project. Should something go awry, we are used to working under pressure and feel we can mitigate any issues that may arise. Additionally, I pledge to communicate to our backers any delays that might take place so no one is left in the dark. This is my business and it would be very bad for my reputation to do otherwise.

updates.update_content: Sorry to anyone getting a 2nd notice who is on our 2nd Kickstarter.  We have our 3rd Kickstarter up right now with our bug alien enemies of the S.T.A.R. Troopers, the INFESTORS.  I invite you to take a look HERE.

Only 4 days left on the 2nd Kickstarter Campaign.  
All Stretch Goal figures opened up for any pledge level of $80.00 or more.  New light BDUs sculpted by Bobby Jackson add-on added as well.   
Check it out
http://kck.st/2cd2erc

We have the next one live.  Here is the link.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1620164718/star-troopers-too

We have fulfilled all backer pledges, except for a few that have not responded to our e-mails, with overwhelmingly positive feedback.  The on-line shop is open with all the models if you need to get any more copies.  I've talked to some folks who have run other kickstarters and apparently it's not uncommon to have a few backers never claim their rewards.  I find this a bit disconcerting as It is my goal to have 100% satisfied backers.  To the few who have not yet requested their rewards, we will still honor your pledges if you run through the shop with your coupon code or contact us directly if you have any questions or issues.

We have now sent all the pledges out that we have received.  There is still around 17 of you that have not turned in your coupon/code.  If you're having difficulty with that, be sure and PM me and we'll get you taken care of.  From our perspective, we have successfully fulfilled this project as every order we have received is fulfilled.  We're now working on some new figures for the next project and I'll post an update here when we're ready to launch.

We have about 1 week worth of orders on hold for the moment.  We've ran out of bases.  The response from our backers has been overwhelming with most of you adding quite a bit of product beyond your pledge level.  That's great and I thank you for that.  Although, we didn't anticipate running through our stock of plastic bases as quickly as we did, a new batch is on order and has been shipped.  I'm anticipating delivery early next week and we'll get all the orders out immediately upon receipt of the plastic bases.  We have everything ready and awaiting their arrival.

We've had about 80% of supporters go through the store as of now.  I believe we have about 10 outstanding orders received over the weekend not yet fulfilled.  We are now receiving repeat customer orders from some of you that had already received your stuff.   You've ordered so much more extra stuff than we anticipated that we actually ran out of the plastic bases for our figures. Unfortunately, we do not have the capability to make our own plastic bases.  Not to worry, we've placed an order with Reaper Minis for more plastic bases and I expect we'll get them soon.  The rest of the supporters we haven't heard from yet should have their coupon/codes for the store.  I'm encouraging everyone to get their orders in before the end of the month so we can wrap this kickstarter project up.  I'm declaring our first experience with Kickstarter an outstanding success largely due to our great group of supporters on this project.  Many of the difficulties we have heard about dealing with kickstarters simply didn't happen.  It's all been very smooth and we should be able to launch into another project shortly.   Thanks to everyone!

The URL change for the store has been successfully completed with the old links remaining active so that concern was much ado about nothing.

We've had some confusion regarding what you need to do in the store so I'll try to address the more common issues here.  It is pretty much a standard on-line cart system but they all have their own little quirks.  
Everyone that pledged $50.00 or more should have received a coupon code and a link to the on-line store.  Once you are there, you can choose whatever product you like.  You can order more or less as you desire though you should purchase at least the amount of your pledge value to use it up.  If you use less than $50.00 at check out, the system will charge you for shipping so it's advisable to use the full amount at one time.

With this kickstarter we plan to fund the production of a broad selection of fantasy themed heroes for use in skirmish table top gaming. To begin I have a set of 5 semi modular warriors fitted for universally interchangeable weapons and heads, a Ranger, and a Wizard. With a Swordsman Hero, a thief, and an apprentice underway to complete a warband of 10 figures.
 Backers can pledge for one warband for $55.00 ( a $75.00 RRP value ) or for individual figures for  $8 each ( a $9 RRP value ) or for one set of the modular Warriors for $25 each ( a $30. RRP value ).
It is my intention to create more Norse themed figures to compliment this warband as funding allows. These plans include 5 semi modular Thugs fitted for universally interchangeable right and left hands and heads, a berserker with two handed axe, a shield maiden, a female ranger, an alternate male ranger, a female wizard and an alternate male wizard. As thee figures are funded they will become items available for selection as add- on rewards.
I will be posting pics of the various Works In Progress of these figures as the campaign develops.
SHIPPING IS NOT INCLUDED IN ANY PLEDGE. 
DO NOT INCLUDE ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO COVER YOUR  POSTAGE PAYMENT IN YOUR PLEDGE IT WILL * NOT * BE APPLIED TO YOUR POSTAGE.
 Any funds collected through the KS system reduce by 10% when KS takes out their fees. This means that any funds collected to cover postage are 10% less than what is actually needed to cover postage IF the postage rates do not increase between the time of billing and shipping.
Postage will be billed by region upon time of readiness for delivery. All postage fees must be paid before shipment can be made. Rewards will be posted from the US to all backer's addresses.
Postage ESTIMATES by region;
US $7.00 and $15.00
UK EU $10.00
AU / NZ/ ROW currently unspecific.
Red Box Games are not responsible for any customs duties, taxes or fees incurred as a result.
US rewards will be shipped via USPS Priority mail and will thus be charged according to the box size needed to safely package your rewards. We do not fuss with extraneous packaging much in the effort to keep postage costs to a minimum to pass those savings along to our backers. We will however package your items safely and securely.
  This project IS EU friendly! All UK and EU rewards packages will be shipped from a fullfillment point in the UK. And I am working on securing an Australian fulfillment point for Australia as well.
  Production is being handled by a very reliable and proven partner Valiant Enterprises located in the US. Valiant has proven again and again that they are proessional, prompt and reliable.. The figures will be produced via traditional methods of spin cast metal and hand poured resin where applicable. Production for metal miniatures is typically very swift and is generally less subject to the delays of foreign production.  
Finally, I am just a guy with a dream to create great fantasy miniatures and possibly one day a great fantasy game. I have worked very hard in this industry for a long time with a long well established line of great products to show for it and the dearly treasured support of a lot of really great people. I have had some hard knocks and things are never easy, but in the end I could never be happy doing anything else. This is where my heart is. I am not at all afraid of hard work and I will always see to it that I deliver on my promises. But in the end I am still just one guy with a dream, skill, and dedication to a goal, I still need your help. I have my ability to sculpt, my ambition to create, my dedication to this purpose, the help of a few very talented friends ( Thanks for all the great Art Dave! ) The support and patience of my darling Wife Kristy, and the help of many wonderful people such as yourself willing to chip in what you can to help make it all possible.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have a great deal of experience in the running and delivery of kickstarters and 7 years experience in the industry dealing with all the various aspects of producing and marketing miniatures. These aspects include design, sculpting, coordinating production, quality control, packaging and shipment. I maintain a very close relationship with my customers and backers well after the sale is made.

I have experienced difficulties in previous kickstarters but have run several successful camapign which delviered on time and to expectation, but even in the kickstarters which delivered late I have always delviered in full as promised.

I very keenly understand the hurtles which may present themselves during the fulfillment of kickstarters and I am ready to deal with any of them. You can rest fully assured that I will deliver your rewards to you if you back my campaign. You are who make it possible for me to do what i love to do and I do NOT take that for granted.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Modular Njorn Footmen WIPs
With this kickstarter we plan to fund the production of Fantasy themed warband starter sets for use in skirmish table top gaming. With each warband set containing all the basic elements needed to play a game of any of a variety of popular table top skirmish games. At the outset, each starter box will contain 5 semi modular warrior figures repeated three times per box for a total of 15 miniatures. These figures include 4 weapon and shield warriors and one archer.
  It is my hope to be able to expand the offering in each starter box as the funding allows me to afford more molds. These expanded offerings might include additional troop types for expanded tactical variety or alternate sculpts to replace repeated sculpts for greater variety.
  The first Warband Set offered is Njorning hirdmen set which includes ;12 hirdmen warriors, and 3 huntsmen. Each of the hirdmen is semi modular being fitted for universally interchangeable heads and right hand options. The right hand options included with the set are 2 swords, 2 axes, a mace and a spear repeated three times in the box for a total of 18 weapon options. There are also 6 different head options repeated three times in the box as well for a total of 18 head options. The archer model is fitted only for a modular head.
Backers can add to their pledge as add -ons are unlocked by managing the value of their pledge upward by the amount necessary to cover the cost of the desired items. Each new add-on posted will be accompanied by a full detailed description of the contents and the cost of the add-on itself.
 SHIPPING IS NOT INCLUDED IN ANY PLEDGE.
Postage will be billed by region upon time of readiness for delivery. All postage fees must be paid before shipment can be made.
Rewards will be posted from the US to all backer's addresses. We are not responsible for any customs duties, taxes or fees incurred as a result.
  The miniatures are cast in a high quality hard PVC plastic produced by a well established and experienced production contractor which handles the manufacturing for several well known table top gaming companies.
 Plastics manufacturing has made a great deal of long strides in the level of quality they are able to capture and reliably produce in miniature scale. many very impressive products have been released recently showcasing just what is possible in the medium. I am very confident both in the examples I have had on hand for comparison and in the research I have conducted over the past 4 years that plastic is definitely the way forward for Red Box Games and the plans I have for future projects.
 I am still however a very cautious person when it comes to new ventures as I have endured some very hard lessons in the past teaching me to take it slow at first. To that end I want to keep this campaign manageably modest in scope. I feel that the plan I have laid out is sound and deliverable within a reasonable span of time and the product offered is excellently made and designed specifically for the medium. I am confident that I will deliver to your full satisfaction.
Finally, I am just a guy with a dream to create great fantasy miniatures and possibly one day a great fantasy game. I have worked very hard in this industry for a long time with a long well established line of great products to show for it and the dearly treasured support of a lot of really great people. I have had some hard knocks and things are never easy, but in the end I could never be happy doing anything else. This is where my heart is. I am not at all afraid of hard work and I will always see to it that I deliver on my promises. But in the end I am still just one guy with a dream, skill, and dedication to a goal, I still need your help. I have my ability to sculpt, my ambition to create, my dedication to this purpose, the help of a few very talented friends ( Thanks for all the great Art Dave! ) The support and patience of my darling Wife Kristy, and the help of many wonderful people such as yourself willing to chip in what you can to help make it all possible.

Thank you very much for your time, your support and encouragement.
Cheers,
Tre'

campaign.story:
Dear Friends,
Thank you!! This project is a dream come true, and your support has been utterly amazing. I am profoundly honored by the success of this fund raising campaign. You can expect a wonderful future for this indie game. 
Make sure to follow along with the progress on Facebook and Instagram. There is a Facebook group called Relicblade Official Battle Friends where you can share photos of your miniatures, and connect with the Relicblade community. 
Relicblade.com is the other spot to keep an eye on as we move into this glorious new dawn. 
Thanks for making this game a reality. 
Your Friend,
 Sean Sutter
Relicblade is a small scale miniatures skirmish game created by Metal King Studio. Players take command of heroes and monsters as they battle to claim magical relics of the ancient world.
Will you lead bold heroes on their righteous quest for hope? Or will you harness the unbound fury of the Pig Men; whose craven lust for destruction is only matched by their love for snacks?
The "Bold Adventurer" two player battle game includes everything you need for start playing full-size games of Relicblade out of the box.
Fully Illustrated Rulebook
Wave 1 Deck: 14 Character Cards, 32 Upgrade Cards, 2 Reference Cards, and 6 Relic Cards
All Wave 1 Heroes
All Wave 1 Pigs
6 Dice
Kickstarter Exclusive Relic Card
ALL UNLOCKED STRETCH GOALS: Relic Miniature, Thief Character, and more to come!
This set is the best way to start playing the game right away!
Relicblade is quick to learn and fun to play. The characters are represented on the board by detailed 30mm miniatures while their statistics and abilities are shown on convenient character cards. The real depth comes in as players choose from 25 unique upgrades to specialize their characters to gain a tactical advantage. Will you choose to specialize your cleric as a support healer, or bestow her with powerful magic weapons to bring low the adversary?
Before the battle players choose characters and upgrades.
Battles are fought over an unidentified magic item that has drawn the characters to that spot. When characters are finally able to seize the relic it is drawn randomly from the Relic Deck. Relics grant an unnatural boon and are used just like upgrades, however they far surpass any upgrade in power. But if the character wielding the relic is disabled anyone can pick it up.
The Knight grabs the Sword of Ruin
Standard games of Relicblade are played on a 2'x2' area, players usually only field between three and six characters, and the games only last around 45 minutes. Games are fast paced, dynamic, and exciting. It's not unusual to play several games over the course of a couple drinks. 
 The Relicblade Core Game has been FUNDED! We are now working our way through awesome new stretch goals!!
Relicblade is super rad. I know you're going to love it. If we can get a bunch of people behind this project it's better for everybody. You want more characters... I want more characters. So let's do this!
Whenever we unlock a new goal everyone backing at Bold Adventurer ($89 early bird, and $99) and above will get it added to their rewards for FREE. Everyone wins!
OH SNAP! I love you guys. Free Relics for everyone!!! (almost)
Rad new hero. Free with "Bold Adventurer" Pledge ($89/$99) or more!
What goes into making new characters?
Oh, I'm glad you asked. The Metal King Studio YouTube channel has a whole web series dedicated not only to this question, but to the production of this very character! Follow along as I draw, sculpt, and produce the thief in an aptly titled series called... Thief.
Relicblade is a good old-fashioned miniatures game. 
Players dive into the miniatures hobby as they assemble, paint, and play the game. Relicblade figures are made of high quality white metal, and the miniatures are supplied unassembled and unpainted. The process of customizing and painting the characters is part of the awesome collaboration between the creator and players. The ruins of Relicblade are largely unexplored, so the depths of this savage world are open for players to invent and discover.
Miniatures are supplied unassembled and unpainted.
What scale are the figures?
Relicblade miniatures are made at the 30mm scale. That means from foot to eye level a character should stand at around 30mm. It's ever so slightly larger than the well known Warhammer scale, but slightly less "heroic" ( giant hands and weapons). 
Relicblade figures lined up with other favorites from my collection
How Relicblade miniatures are made.
Relicblade is 100% independent and creator owned. However, the process for creating these metal miniatures is extremely similar to the production process from your favorite miniatures companies. I even use the same prototyping company, mold maker, and caster as some of my most loved games.
1. The first step is to create a character that is at least vaguely interesting. For the Questing Knight I did a bunch of research on knightly arms and armor. I especially lost myself in YouTube videos of Battle of the Nations and other HEMA groups.
2. Using ZBrush I create a 3D model of the figure. From the very beginning I have to consider how the model will look at the tiny 30mm scale and how it will work for mold making and casting.
3. Rapid prototypes are a quick low resolution 3D print of the model. Using the Form 1+ printer I was able to see what was working and what wasn't. It's extremely important to see how the parts fit together and make sure everything is at the appropriate scale.
 4. Once the design is finalized and all the issues are resolved, the files are sent to VisionProto for high resolution prototypes that can withstand the mold making process. These prototypes are quite costly, but offer unmatched detail and fidelity.
5. The high resolution prototypes are sent to a mold-maker and caster. The master and production molds were made by Fortress Figures. With the molds established the figures are cast by the hundreds in high quality white metal.
6. The final stage is when players paint the figures and play out legendary adventures. The final product is a collaborative art piece that unites friends, gamers, and hobbyists around the world.
Greetings friends,
My name is Sean Sutter. I am a professional freelance artist and illustrator, and the lead artist on the comic book series B-Squad: Soldiers of Misfortune. As a freelance artist there can be gaps between jobs or even simple hours here and there while you wait for a sketch to be approved. Relicblade was more or less born in these gaps. 
B-Squad Volume 1 Cover Art by Sean Sutter
I've been obsessed with tabletop miniatures since I first walked into a game shop and saw that they existed. And like many of you, I harbored dreams of creating a game. 20 years later I realized that I'm still crazy about miniatures, but I am also an able illustrator and writer. So I taught myself how to sculpt miniatures in ZBrush.
ZBrush is extraordinary. I've studied drawing my entire life. I did over ten years of weekly figure drawing and have a bachelors degree of fine art. But drawing has always been a process of translation for me. While drawing I work to translate a three-dimensional idea into two-dimensions, which is always the major challenge. But once I learned the basics for ZBrush I was finally home. My thee-dimensional imagination just needs to be transcribed into ZBrush... I can't adequately describe how artistically fulfilling sculpting is.
I sculpted that bear while I was waiting for a poster design to get approved by the Crocker Art Museum.
Game design has been a joy, as well. I put forward core design principals and set about creating a game. As I got deeper in the game design I obsessively asked and answered questions through every step. I would toss and turn at night trying to figure out gameplay mechanics. After months of fevered game-craft Relicblade was complete. Now, each time I play it I am delighted at how well Relicblade meets its design goals.
Asset drawings, card prototypes, and probably a pot of coffee on my desk.
While learning to sculpt and filling notebooks with ideas took place in the gaps between freelance gigs, the hardcore making of the game had to be a full time endeavor. In July of 2015 I started creating Relicblade full-time. It's been a crazy adventure so far, and I really hope with this Kickstarter it is just the beginning. I have ideas coming out my ears and a really great game. 
Now that the rules, cards, and figures are in print I can take a step back and just enjoy the game instead of critiquing it. We are still finding crazy new upgrade combinations and party-builds. Just last night I had one of the most exciting games to date. 
Ultra fun Relicblade demos at Great Escape Games in Sacramento. That's me with the cool orange hat!
I hope you will step out on a limb to try this new game. There are a ton of great games out there, but I know after a few games Relicblade will be one of your favorites, too. Plus, supporting independent artists has intrinsic value. ;)
Your Friend,
Sean Sutter
Click photo to go to the B-Squad campaign page!
B-Squad is a crazy action-packed comedy that follows a band of misfit mercs on dangerous and ridiculous missions. In volume one the squadies did battle with a hive-mind of wiener dogs, and a dangerous band of James Cameron cosplayers. While Eben Burgoon is writing each issue he spins a six-sided whale-bone die to determine which of the six main characters will be killed on the mission. Ridiculous. Dangerous. Expendable.
Getting paid to draw for B-Squad empowered me to believe in myself and make Relicblade. In B-Squad Volume 2 we will be empowering a new batch of artists! When you #BackBSquad you aren't just getting a book. You're showing artists that they deserve to get paid, and encouraging them to make something awesome.
If you back both B-Squad and Relicblade, you'll also receive an exclusive Relic Card modeled after the very dice that slays all the B-Squad characters, The Pequod!
 What's a Custom Character Card?
You can tell me about a D&D character you used to play as, or any character you imagine. Then I will do an original illustration of that character. But the fun won't stop there! I will also stick that character in a character card and make up some sweet rules and stats for your them!
Now that barbarian you have fond memories of playing back in high-school can roam the wild lands of Relicblade!
You get the original illustration and a professionally printed copy of your card (Character, or monster, or relic, or whatever...)
Porter McScotch, B-Squad writer Eben Burgoon's Dwarf Bard
 But, what if I want a miniature of my awesome character?
It costs money, but it's pretty amazing seeing your characters come to life this way. Also, these high pledge levels really help support the studio.
Custom hand-made Relicblade terrain:
You want Relicblade? Say no more. I will personally hand craft a 2'x2' board for you in whatever setting you want. I'll do my best studio-quality work to get you a seriously awesome board. The 2'x2' panels hang on your wall while not in use and make really crazy 3D fantasy landscape paintings. It's an absurd amount of work, but you're worth it. I'll even paint up a full set of Relicblade figures to match your adventure setting. Frozen city, ancient tomb, or lava fort? Follow your heart.
 Here is a little chart that should help clarify the pledge levels.
What are Add-Ons?
Add-ons give Backers the option to add extra bits to their rewards for a little extra money. This is the best opportunity for people to grab extra components to optimize their Relicblade experience.
The Two-Player set is specially designed to give you everything you'll need to get the full Relicblade Experience. But if you want a few extra Pigs this is the way to get the promotional deal available only through the Kickstarter.
 Using the Marketplace below you can look at what is available and adjust your pledge accordingly. I want to make sure you get everything you want out of this Kickstarter campaign, and I believe this will help.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you say, "I want to make a game." people will ask "have you thought about Kickstarter?"

Kickstarter has become an everyday occurrence for the tabletop gaming industry. Which has, I believe, very positive implications for the future of independent games. But that also means you can get ahead of yourself and start asking for money before you really have a game. I don't want to ask you to support a project that is just an idea. Even if I think it's a pretty good one.

This risks and challenges section of the campaign is probably the part I've fought the hardest for. At the outset of a project like this you have to ask yourself a lot of questions, and you have to look at each obstacle as gatekeepers. Just past those cold hearted sentinels was the game I wanted to make. Bringing a game from drawings and notes all the way to miniatures and rulebooks was daunting, but it's done. I already went through my delays. There were countless challenges that I wasn't expecting, but I crushed them. And I worked on this game full-time for eight months before it was ready for Kickstarter.

The game is done. Relicblade is being played by gamers across the entire world, and they love it. But I was only able to make 100 copies, and the game currently exists with the minimum number of characters needed to play. If I write four emails I can have the Relicblade two-player sets ready to ship in three weeks, because everything is done. But I want to make the game bigger and better too. If we can unlock the stretch goals we can do just that.

Making new characters means new illustrations, sculpts, 3d prints, molds, rules, and cards. So the risks and challenges aren't completely eliminated. But I know how to take a sketch and turn it into an excellent game. Delays will almost certainly happen, but I'm ready... Are you?
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Did you miss the Kickstarter? Go to www.skyheartcomic.com to stay up to date on the project!
I'm Jake Parker, and I'm making SkyHeart Book I: The Star Seed. 
SkyHeart is an all-ages graphic novel inspired by my favorite movies and comics. If you liked Miyazaki's Nausicaa, Star Wars, Tokien's The Hobbit, and Indiana Jones, then you just might become a fan of SkyHeart. 
SkyHeart will be a 7.5 x 10 inch 100+ page book that comes in both soft and hard cover editions. 
The book is being written and drawn by me and is scheduled to be finished in May of 2016, and shipped out to backers in October of 2016.
For years I've been developing this project on the side, but it was so big, and so involved that it scared me! I felt I wasn't ready to create this book. 
After years working in animation as a concept artist (Horton Hears a Who, Rio, Epic) and comics (Flight, Missile Mouse, Rocket Raccoon) my skills as an artist and storyteller got better. I feel like I'm finally at a level now where I can take on a project like this and do it justice.
So...I'm going for it!
The Idea for SkyHeart was planted in my imagination over 15 years ago while on a road trip though the Arizona desert. I imagined the desert floor vanishing, leaving only an abyss of clouds with the rock formations suspended above them in the air.
From that seed of an idea grew an entire world of characters and their struggles, with mythologies, cities, and technology fleshing out the rest of this universe.
I love classic tales of adventure, of good versus evil, and struggles with real consequences. Which is why I look to films like Star Wars, Nausicaa, Castle in the Sky, and Indiana Jones, and books like the Hobbit for inspiration. Just because a story is all-ages, doesn't mean I can't enjoy it as much as my kids do!
SkyHeart takes place on Airth, a world literally torn apart by a pre-historic war between the gods who created it. That war left the planet divided into 4 realms:
The Stratos, a chain of islands high in the sky where the Sylph people live.
The Rimland, a massive ring of continents and giant islands where most of the inhabitants of Airth live. Wake, our main protagonist, lives here.
The Abyss, a stretch of atmosphere filled with incredible cloud formations and tiny floating islands. Limberg and Grimm are from here. 
The Core, an ocean covered rocky sphere filled with colossal caves. The Tengru, monsters and beasts, and the Dark Lord live down here.
In that great ancient war, the beings of Light were able to defeat the Shadows and banish them to the core, but not without a great cost. Losing most of their godly energy, they left Airth to search the universe for more power. Their children stayed to protect what was left of Airth from the evil trapped in the core. 
Thousands of years later these pre-historic events have become myth, and the inhabitants of Airth are consumed with their own wars for power. 
However, deep in the core, the Shadows have not forgotten, and have begun sending their agents to the surface to harvest the people of their life force. Once enough of this power has been taken the Shadows will rise again to destroy the rest of Airth and start a new world.
Wake and his crew set off to find the Star Seed with the hopes of both saving Wake's mother, and the world of Airth. That is, if they can beat Malsang and his sinister tengru to it's secret location. 
How Do Add Ons Work?
I'll be using Backer Kit to handle rewards and add-ons. Here's what you do:
Add up the total of your selections (plus shipping if it applies) 
Click "Manage Your Pledge" in the upper right corner (blue button) 
Add the total of your Add Ons to your pledge amount. You don't need to change the tier you've selected 
You are done! Later you'll get a backer survey asking how you spent your add-on dollars and for other pertinent info. 
Thank you!

I'll be updating the add ons and adding more if the project funds and we hit stretch goals. I want to add a map of Airth, a poster, and more, so check back.
I'm asking for A LOT of money. I've got a great youtube video here that outlines where all this money is going and how I arrived at this number. Basically, half the funds are going to the production of the content, and the other half is getting the books printed and shipped. 
Here's a breakdown of where the funds are going:
Printing: $12,000 This covers getting the books printed and shipped to my house. (15.4%)
Production: $42,000 This covers my time writing and drawing the book, paying a colorist, editor, and building the book and getting it ready for print. (53.8%)
Fees: $8000 This covers Backer Kit, Kickstarter and Amazon fees. (9%)
Shipping: $16,000 This covers packing up the books and shipping charges. I will be shipping the books PRIORITY MAIL to US backers to ensure the safe delivery of each package. International orders will all be sent FIRST CLASS. Orders will be packed in a bubble wrap sleeve, then put into heavy duty cardboard case. I talk all about how I ship things in this video. (23.4%)
This book will be produced in the spring and summer of 2016 and will be delivered to backers in September of that same year. Here's a rough timeline of the production:
November: Run the Kickstarter
December: Finish the SkyHeart manuscript
January - June: Drawing and coloring
July: Building the book, and prepping for print
August - September: Printing the book
October: Packing and Shipping
Hi I'm Jake Parker, and here's a little bit about me written in third person to sound official: 
Jake Parker is an illustrator and cartoonist. For the last 17 years he's worked on everything from animated films to comics to picture books. His credits include the animated films Titan A.E., Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs, Horton Hears a Who, Rio, and Epic. 
He illustrated the New York Times bestselling book The Astonishing Secret of Awesome Man, and went on to also illustrate The Girl Who Wouldn't Brush Her Hair, The Tooth Fairy Wars, The Little Snowplow, and most recently finished his first children's book that he also wrote, Little Bot and Sparrow which will be available in fall of 2016.
Along with children's books Jake also draws comics, and recently finished five issues of Marvel's Rocket Raccoon. His Missile Mouse graphic novel series, published by Scholastic, have sold over 100,000 copies. His own self-published comics anthology The Antler Boy and Other Stories was funded through Kickstarter at over $85,000. 
Jake is the creator of the Inktober challenge and World Art Drop Day, with both initiatives involving thousands of artists across the world. He's taught at Brigham Young University and is the co-founder of SVSLearn.com, an online art school specializing in visual storytelling. 
He and his wife Alison live in Provo with their five kids, two cats, and five chickens. You can learn more about Jake and see his work at www.mrjakeparker.com

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third Kickstarter and I fully recognize that unforeseeable problems might pop up. From production delays to collaborator mishaps to malfunctions with the printing press any number of setbacks could arise and push the delivery date of this project back. 

However, with my experience in self publishing and comics I'm confident that any potential obstacles will be dealt with swiftly and professionally. 

I understand the faith that backers have in me and my project so I'll be very transparent with everything that goes into the production of this book by posting frequent and timely updates, and being quick to notify backers of any setbacks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
